name: Aatrox
rationale: Aatrox is a Diver-style fighter: a melee brawler who closes with enemies to contest space and force fights. His kit centers on timed empowered strikes and chained multi-sweep attacks that reward directional aim and hit-zone control, paired with a binding tool that punishes movement and creates forced repositioning. Mobility is flexible—an instant dash that can be used while casting—while his durability arises from heavy self-healing tied to damage and a transformative activation that greatly boosts movement, damage and sustain and that is extended by champion takedowns. Strategically he offers front-to-back disruption and sustained skirmishing: excelling in isolated duels, extended brawls, objective fights and split-push pressure.

name: Ahri
rationale: Ahri is a mobile skirmisher mage who embodies the Skirmisher archetype through short, repeatable bursts of movement and single-target pick rather than sustained frontline presence. Mechanically she layers targeted crowd control and precision-based projectile pressure with rapid repositioning, converting movement and skill-sequence execution into high-burst windows while rewarding clean takedowns with on-hit self-sustain; her toolkit mixes auto-seeking and returning projectiles that change trade dynamics and enable both poke and follow-up burst. Strategically, Ahri brings consistent single-target pickup and roving pressure, strong outplay and escape potential, flexible wave management, and a skirmish-focused toolkit that favors roaming, picks, and assassination over prolonged teamfight frontline roles.

name: Akali
rationale: Akali is an Assassin: a mobile, single-target burst champion whose design privileges assassination and skirmish play over sustained frontline duty. Her identity is combo-driven and position-focused, built around concealment and mark/reactivation mobility—she creates tactical zones that reward exiting for empowered follow-up strikes, hides in a smoke that enables resets and ambiguous approach paths, and uses markable projectiles plus a recastable dash to chain targeted gap-closes; her ultimate is a direct, re‑castable strike tool for committing to or finishing targets. Strategically, she supplies reliable pick threat, flank and roam pressure, and high outplay potential in short trades, excelling at isolating priority foes while depending on stealth and mobility to avoid prolonged engagements.

name: Akshan
rationale: Akshan reads as a Skirmisher because he blends sustained ranged damage with high-mobility, duelist tools that prioritize single-target kills and outplay potential. Mechanically he revolves around on-hit stacking and follow‑up strikes that convert sustained fire into burst windows and short defensive survivability, while his toolkit rewards precise skillshot hits and terrain-enabled movement to repeatedly enter and exit fights; a long‑range returning attack exposes foes and a targeted power‑charge provides a high-risk, high-reward execution option. Strategically he supplies potent pick and skirmish pressure, flank and chase mobility, and an uncommon macro lever: incentivized takedowns that restore ally fighting capacity and deny enemy advantages, enabling comeback plays and decisive isolated trades.

name: Alistar
rationale: Alistar functions as a Warden— a frontline, disruption-first protector who forces fights on his terms by displacing and incapacitating enemies to shield allies. Mechanically he is a CC-driven engager and sustain conduit: his kit revolves around chaining hard crowd control and purposeful repositioning, building internal stacks from successful disruptions and nearby takedowns to convert aggression into area healing and persistent close-range pressure, while a self-cleanse and large damage mitigation window let him ignore enemy lockdown and remain a durable anchor. Strategically, Alistar provides reliable hard-engage and peel, strong objective initiation and contesting, consistent teamfight disruption, and a space-creating frontline that enables skirmishes and secures fragile teammates.

name: Ambessa
rationale: Ambessa reads as a Diver: a mobile, melee engager who forces close-quarters confrontations and locks down priority targets. Mechanically she centers on building Medarda Maxim through ability windows that empower her basic attacks—extending reach, impact, and energy sustain—while a convertible defensive tool can be immediately turned into a gap-close, creating deliberate initiation windows. Her kit rewards directional sequencing and positional timing, chaining slashes, area ground strikes and spins to control space, apply slows, and amplify follow-up hits. Strategically she supplies reliable single-target lockdown and execution potential, flexible flank initiation, sustained dueling pressure, and disruptive area control that reshapes enemy movement and punishes mistimed retreats.

name: Amumu
rationale: Warden — a short‑range, durable initiator whose identity centers on area lockdown and sustained disruption. Mechanically he couples a single‑target engage tool that forces him into the fight with persistent, proximity‑based damage and a mark mechanic that amplifies allied magic follow‑up; he is rewarded for absorbing basic attacks through self‑mitigation and cooldown recovery, enabling repeated frontline presence. Strategically he provides reliable multi‑target crowd control and zoning for teamfights, hard engage and pick potential, and a layered threat that converts enemy max‑health stacking and allied magic damage into high payoff during extended skirmishes and objective fights.

name: Anivia
rationale: Anivia is an Artillery Mage: a long‑range, control‑centric caster who shapes space and tempo rather than trading sustained mobility or dueling power. Mechanically she functions as a zoning engine that layers persistent area damage and movement impairment with a single impactful setup combo that amplifies follow‑up damage; her tools create hard terrain and a threatened area that forces enemy pathing and commitment, while a unique revival mechanic turns death into a brief defensive objective opponents must finish. Strategically she provides deterministic area denial and siege pressure, reliable poke and wave management, pick and choke‑point control in fights, and a safe, immobile source of teamfight control that converts successful setups into decisive sustained damage.

name: Annie
rationale: As an Artillery Mage she delivers concentrated, short-window burst and area denial through a kit built around a stacking passive that converts ability usage into a guaranteed crowd-control trigger. Mechanically she revolves around timing that charge to enable a single spell or combo to decisively lock a target, pairing a kill-reset single-target nuke with reliable AoE damage for waveclear and teamfights, a defensive shield that grants mobility and punishes attackers, and a summoned ally that provides persistent zone control and on‑hit burn. Strategically she supplies reliable pick-and-burst threat, compact area denial and objective pressure, predictable engage windows for teammates, and strong single-spell payoff for coordinated follow-up.

name: Aphelios
rationale: Aphelios is a Marksman defined by a dual-weapon resource system that forces deliberate sequencing and micro-decisions. His kit revolves around alternating armaments with distinct on‑hit identities and consumable actives that expend discrete charges; when a weapon’s ammo is depleted another is auto-equipped, creating a predictable but deep rotation to manage. This yields a mechanical identity centered on weapon-state management and timing rather than simple sustained attack trading — players must align current weapons with range, tempo and target priority. Strategically he delivers a broad palette of damage profiles (long-range precision, close-range sustain, area damage) plus zoning and utility, acting as an adaptable primary DPS and wave-control tool that rewards planning, positioning, and resource awareness.

name: Ashe
rationale: Ashe is a Marksman: a long‑range sustained damage dealer who exerts control from the outskirts of fights by amplifying and relying on her basic attacks while shaping enemy movement. Mechanically she revolves around attack augmentation and a chargeable DPS window—her kit augments autos with persistent slowing effects, builds a focus resource through attacks to unlock a rapid‑fire state, and pairs straightforward cone poke with global scouting and a distance‑scaling crowd control ultimate. Strategically she supplies reliable sustained damage, pervasive zone control and peel via slows, long‑range pick and initiation potential, and macro value through vision and pressure that aids sieges, rotations, and kiting-heavy team compositions.

name: Aurelion Sol
rationale: Aurelion Sol fits the Artillery Mage archetype: a long-range, zone-oriented caster who exerts influence from distance rather than frontline skirmishing. Mechanically he is built around a permanent scaling passive that incrementally amplifies his toolkit and an aerial state that both grants mobility and converts his primary beam into an uninterrupted, higher-powered sustained damage channel while allowing spellcasts in transit. His kit layers persistent area denial with concentrated gravitational fields and high-impact area CC, combining soft zoning (continuous damage and space control) with occasional hard interruption. Strategically he provides exceptional siege and objective control, layered teamfight crowd-control and disruption, and the ability to pressure side lanes or force rotations through aerial repositioning and long-range threat projection.

name: Aurora
rationale: Aurora functions as an Artillery Mage: a ranged spellcaster who shapes fights from a distance with layered projectiles, area denial, and single-target finishing power. Mechanically she revolves around a stacking execution mechanic that converts sustained hits into percent-based punishment and spawns spectral followers that amplify her self-sustain, while her kit features conditional recasts and returning projectiles that reward timed skill use and target marking. Mobility is woven into her spellset—short stealth/translocation windows, a protective leap, and positional propulsion let her dodge threats and re-enter skirmishes. Strategically she offers poke and pick potential, zone control through slows and a rift, private sustain into extended trades, and reliable repositioning to threaten isolated targets or escape danger.

name: Azir
rationale: Azir is an Artillery Mage who projects sustained, long-range pressure through summoned constructs rather than direct spell bursts, fitting the siege-and-zone control profile. Mechanically he is a summoned-unit controller: his primary damage and reach come from autonomous soldiers and temporary turret-like discs whose potency depends on his proximity, turning placement and presence into both offense and defense. He converts placement into mobility and survivability by tethering himself to those constructs to reposition and guard himself, and his signature formation creates a moving line that displaces enemies to reshape engagements. Strategically he provides layered area denial, sustained poke, objective and tower pressure, pick-orientated zoning and reliable peel by forcing enemy movement and controlling space from range.

name: Bard
rationale: Bard is a Playmaker/Utility Support whose core archetype is roaming tempo control—he rewards map movement with persistent resources that augment basic attacks and enable extended presence across the map. Mechanically he functions as a resource‑accumulator and toolkit crafter: wandering to collect map chimes that empower harassment, placing ephemeral heal zones, firing a chainable projectile that can create immobilizing setup when it interacts with terrain or targets, carving one‑way terrain portals for allied repositioning, and delivering a point‑target global stasis. Strategically he supplies pick potential, macro rotation speed, creative engages and disengages, objective tempo control, and high-value saves or interruptions—trading direct sustain for versatile, game‑wide utility and playmaking.

name: Bel'Veth
rationale: Bel'Veth is a Skirmisher: a mobile, melee duelist built to chase, reset and out-sustain single targets in extended fights. Mechanically she orients around an attack-cadence engine and temporary combat stacks that are consumed by hits, directional mobility with independent reset windows, and a hit-reset loop that rewards landing champion strikes to maintain aggressive positioning. Her kit trades raw single-hit power for extreme strike frequency, layered sustain through a defensive posture that converts cadence into life, and an escalating true-damage ramp that punishes focused consecutive strikes. Strategically she provides relentless one-on-one threat, objective and monster pressure via takedown resources, flank and chase potential, and a late-fight presence that forces disciplined target control and positional responses from opponents.

name: Blitzcrank
rationale: Blitzcrank is a Warden — a front-line disruption tank defined by single-target displacement and high-impact initiation. Mechanically he revolves around a catch-and-chain pattern: a long-range, commitment-oriented reposition that forces enemies out of place, short burst mobility that enables aggressive approaches but leaves a brief recovery window, an empowered melee strike that amplifies follow-up lockdown, a resource-tied emergency shield for survivability, and a charged area discharge that strips defenses and silences nearby foes. Together these elements create a pick-heavy, binary playstyle that trades bursty commitment for game-altering control. Strategically he offers reliable pick potential, zone denial and peel, objective control through forced positioning, and a durable front line that shapes enemy movement to enable allied follow-up.

name: Brand
rationale: Brand is an Artillery Mage: a long-range, area-damage spellcaster who shapes fights through poke, zone control, and explosive collateral damage. Mechanically he centers on applying a persistent burn mark that empowers follow-up spells and eventually detonates to spread damage, which makes his play revolve around deliberate sequencing and accurate skillshots to chain enhanced effects across multiple enemies; finishing blows refund resources, reinforcing spell-focused waveclear and sustained trading. Strategically he provides heavy magic AoE and siege presence, punishes clustered or mispositioned targets with chained explosions, and offers reliable secondary crowd control via his burn-enhanced stuns and slows, serving as a primary poke/zone tool and burst-oriented teamfight centerpiece.

name: Braum
rationale: Braum is a Warden whose design centers on durable protection, zone control, and team-enabled crowd control. Mechanically he plays as a positional guardian who trades his own mobility and defenses to create safety windows for allies: his kit emphasizes coordinated CC through a team-contributable stacking stun, directional interception of enemy projectiles that converts incoming pressure into protected space, short dives toward allies that boost his survivability, and a linear disruption that displaces and impedes foes. Strategically he serves as a peel-and-engage anchor who denies approaches, soaks damage, creates tempo for allied follow-up, secures objectives through area denial, and amplifies teamfight success via reliable protection and setup.

name: Briar
rationale: Briar is a Skirmisher: a melee duelist built to close, stick, and out-sustain single targets in extended fights rather than trade from range. Mechanically she revolves around stackable bleed that deals ongoing damage while converting enemies' missing health into self-healing, empowered attacks that extend reach and scale off targets' missing health, and layered mobility/engage tools that create windows to commit and chain follow-ups. A chargeable sustain state grants damage reduction and multiple recasts for prolonged trades, and her ultimate locks on and reveals a priority target before surging in to deliver disruptive AoE fear. Strategically, she supplies reliable single-target lockdown and pick pressure, durable skirmishing and objective threat via execute-style damage and built-in recovery, plus localized teamfight disruption and peel through immobilize and fear.

name: Caitlyn
rationale: Caitlyn is a Marksman built around extreme range and precision—an artillery-style ADC who wins fights by dictating where and when engagements happen. Mechanically she revolves around building and expending empowered auto-attacks augmented by deliberate setup tools: long-range charged poke with linear penetration, concealed snares that reveal and immobilize to guarantee follow-up damage, and a recoil reposition that enforces spacing and kiting. Strategically she excels at zone control, punishment of overextension, and creating long-range pick windows; she delivers safe sustained single-target pressure, reliable siege and lane poke, and the ability to convert positional advantages into high-value takedowns while maintaining distancing from threats.

name: Camille
rationale: Camille functions as a Diver–a mobile melee fighter designed to single out high-value targets and win extended face-to-face trades. Her mechanical identity revolves around empowered melee strikes with a recast and damage-amplification window, a conditional defensive layer that adapts to opponent damage types, short invulnerability windows for committed cone attacks that heal on successful multi-hit trades, and terrain-tethered mobility that converts walls into long-range initiation and repositioning tools. Strategically she brings guaranteed single-target lockdown and reliable flank engages, sustained one-on-one dueling and skirmish presence, and strong pick/zone control that forces isolated fights while enabling split-pressure through self-sufficient survivability and high-value target denial.

name: Cassiopeia
rationale: Artillery Mage — Cassiopeia functions as a zone-centric, sustained-damage mage who controls space and punishes positioning. Mechanically she revolves around applying and maintaining poison to amplify a rapid, low-cooldown single-target strike that restores resources and sustains her, while her toolkit layers lingering area denial and a directional crowd-control burst that severely penalizes enemies who face her. Her movement profile is unusual: she gains intrinsic mobility as she progresses rather than relying on conventional mobility items, reinforcing a playstyle that anchors fights rather than skirmishes away. Strategically she brings persistent DPS, territorial denial, execution and pick potential, shaping teamfights by locking enemies into damaging ground and creating windows for teammates to follow up or disengage.

name: Cho'Gath
rationale: Cho'Gath reads as a Warden — a durable frontline who controls space with disruptive, hard crowd control while simultaneously posing a persistent single-target execute threat. Mechanically he is a scaling melee brawler built around permanent growth via consume stacks and sustained tankiness from unit kills, combining innate sustain with layered disruption (airborne displacement, silence, slows) and on‑hit spikes that punish high-health targets. Strategically he provides reliable frontline anchoring, peel and area denial, objective-secure pressure and lane bullying; he excels in extended fights and skirmishes where his permanent scaling and zoning convert durability into decisive battlefield control.

name: Corki
rationale: Corki is a Marksman defined by mid-range poke and mixed-type sustained damage: he functions as a ranged DPS who blends ability burst, area explosions, and consistent basic-attack augmentation. Mechanically he combines on‑hit true damage on autos with alternating modes of output—longer-range explosive poke and a short, mobile sustained-damage posture that controls space—rewarding rhythmically weaving attacks and abilities to maximize mixed magical/physical pressure and area denial. Strategically he offers reliable teamfight DPS and siege poke, dependable waveclear and objective pressure, and flexible skirmishing: he can harass from safe distances, reveal and punish targets, contest clustered fights with AoE explosions, and reposition to kite or apply split pressure.

name: Darius
rationale: Darius is a Diver: a front-line melee brawler built to lock onto high-value targets, force short-range engagements, and punish clustered or isolated enemies. Mechanically he revolves around applying and ramping a persistent bleed through attacks and abilities, then converting those stacks into powerful execution windows; his kit rewards sustained close-range contact, precise positioning for maximum-weapon-edge hits, and aggressive timing to secure kills that grant ability refreshes. Strategically he supplies reliable single-target execution, durable frontline threat, and local area control—pulling and slowing foes to deny escape, sustaining through edge-based healing, and creating reset-driven carry potential that punishes mispositioning and enables decisive skirmish follow-through.

name: Diana
rationale: Diana fits the Diver archetype—she's designed to commit to and survive close-quarters engagements, leaping into priority targets to disrupt backlines and trade in melee. Mechanically she is a spell-driven melee caster that synchronizes empowered basic attacks with a mark-and-prime system, pairs a self-buffing shield with orbiting detonations that reward timing, and uses a conditional gap-closer whose cooldown collapses against marked foes alongside a gravitational pull ultimate that scales with how many champions are caught. The kit emphasizes chaining casts and on-hit cleaves to extend fights and reopen engages. Strategically she provides reliable single-target dive and short-range AoE initiation, pick potential via reveal/marking, and compact teamfight disruption that punishes grouping and enables decisive follow-up.

name: Mundo
rationale: Juggernaut — a durable frontline who specializes in prolonging fights through self-renewal and damage resilience, fitting the juggernaut role by forcing enemies to expend focused burst to stop him. Mechanically he is built around sustained self-healing tied to his maximum health, a periodic anti-immobilize that trades current health for a persistent, contestable resource, on-hit and area tools that refund health when they connect, a channel that stores incoming damage to be discharged, and an auto-empowered strike that scales with max health and missing health to amplify finishing pressure. Strategically he provides reliable frontline soaking, long-fight dueling and split pressure, objective-contesting presence via his consumable interactables, and a playstyle that punishes drawn-out engagements and encourages opponents to coordinate high-burst removal or contested skirmishes.

name: Draven
rationale: Draven is a Marksman defined by extreme single-target offensive throughput and a high-risk, high-reward snowball identity: he is a lane bully who converts mechanical mastery directly into economic and kill pressure. Mechanically his kit centers on juggling empowered, ricocheting axes that amplify basic attacks and interact with a personal attack-speed/mobility window—catching axes is both a mechanical requirement and a resource loop that refreshes momentum—while a separate accumulated bounty mechanic is consumed on champion takedowns to accelerate his power spike. Strategically he brings relentless lane dominance, focused execute and sustained DPS that threaten carries and structures, plus moderate utility in the form of a directional displacement/slow and a long-range finishing tool, making him a primary front-to-back damage engine whose value depends on positioning, tempo control, and consistent mechanical execution.

name: Ekko
rationale: Ekko reads as an Assassin because his kit prioritizes rapid single-target burst, high mobility, and timing-based outplay over sustained teamfight frontlining. Mechanically he functions as a mobile skirmisher who layers a stacking on-hit tempo effect with a returning skillshot for zoning and poke, a delayed area zone that punishes poor positioning while granting him defensive buffer, a gap-closing empowered attack that repositions him instantly, and an ultimate that rewinds his position and health to convert damage taken into a clutch survival and counterplay tool. Strategically he supplies reliable flank and pick pressure, burst threat in isolated fights, dynamic in-and-out skirmishing, and a built‑in reversal mechanic that enables high-risk dives and game-changing outplays.

name: Elise
rationale: Elise fits the Diver archetype because her kit is designed to close distance, lock down a priority target, and convert an engagement into a quick, committed melee kill; she excels at initiating and sticking through mobility and a single-target crowd control tool. Mechanically she is a dual-form engager that toggles between a safer, ranged harassment and summon-focused mode and an aggressive melee apex that amplifies basic-attack potency and attack tempo; she layers persistent auxiliary units, a leap/retarget aerial reposition, and a single-target immobilize to create windows for committed dives. Strategically she supplies reliable pick potential and dive initiation, layered zone control via summoned spiders, heightened early-to-mid skirmish pressure and objective-threat through strong single-target execution and repositioning flexibility.

name: Evelynn
rationale: Evelynn is an Assassin—an ambush-oriented skirmisher that specializes in stalking and quickly eliminating single high-value targets from stealth. Mechanically she orbits a camouflage state that enables approach and disengage, a curse/expunge interaction that creates timed kill windows, repeatable projectile damage for sustained spike potential, and a mobility-heavy on-hit dash that synergizes with re-entering shadow to refresh offensive options; her finisher grants brief untargetability and a relocating execute that doubles as an escape. Strategically she supplies reliable pick pressure, flank control and roaming threat, converting map invisibility into space denial and single-target removal at the cost of sustained front-line presence.

name: Ezreal
rationale: Ezreal reads as an Artillery Mage: a long-range, skillshot-reliant damage dealer who shapes fights from distance rather than through hard crowd control. Mechanically he is built around precision and tempo—he accumulates a stacking self-buff that increases sustained attack rate, rewards hitting skillshots by reducing ability downtime, and uses a mark-and-detonate interaction to recover resource and maintain output; a short self-teleport that simultaneously fires a projectile ties repositioning directly to offense. Strategically he supplies safe, consistent poke, mobile single-target pressure and strong kiting—scaling into a sustained DPS role that can influence fights and map pressure across long ranges while demanding high mechanical execution.

name: Fiddlesticks
rationale: Fiddlesticks reads as an Artillery Mage because his core role is delivering devastating area control from surprise positions rather than sustained frontline trading. Mechanically he functions as an ambush-driven zone controller: he plants deceptive effigies to mimic presence and deny information, sets up committed, high-impact engages through a blinked AoE channel, and couples fear-and-amplified-burst with sustained drains and layered crowd-control (slow, silence) to both punish clustered targets and self-sustain during chaos. Strategically he provides reliable initiation and disruptive teamfight zoning, pick threat from fog and flank angles, vision pressure through mimicry and brief sweeps, and forces opponents to respect threats of sudden, area-denying ultimates that restructure fights around his positioning.

name: Fiora
rationale: Fiora is a Duelist: a high-skill single-target duelist who excels in isolated fights and outplays through precise timing. Her mechanical identity revolves around identifying and striking specific Vitals to convert precision into decisive rewards—true-damage finishing power, sustain, and sudden mobility—while weaving empowered auto-attacks and short dashes that trigger on-hit effects and refresh opportunities to re-engage. A reactive parry turns enemy crowd control and burst against them, creating high-reward windows for follow-up punishment. Strategically she provides reliable single-target execution, split-push and skirmish threat, localized sustain for allies after successful takedowns, and a playstyle that prioritizes timing, target focus, and duel dominance.

name: Fizz
rationale: Fizz reads as a Diver with strong Assassin leanings: his kit is built to close on and eliminate priority targets by diving into the enemy back line. Mechanically he combines permanent ghost-like mobility and an untargetable vault with a gap-closer that procs on-hit effects and a persistent on-hit bleed and empowered strike, creating a play pattern of short, committed entry bursts followed by sustained bleed pressure if he sticks. His toolkit rewards timed invulnerability and repositioning to dodge retaliation and reset fights, and his long-range summon delivers area displacement for setup or peel. Strategically he offers reliable single-target assassination and pick threat, high skirmish and roam pressure, and disruptive flank/diving presence that forces opponents to respect space and engage windows.

name: Galio
rationale: Warden — a large, tanky protector whose design prioritizes area control and allied safeguard: he functions as a frontline anchor that both soaks and dishes out disruptive magic damage. Mechanically he blends a cyclical empowered melee identity that rewards sustained, in-close engagements (with on-hit empowerment that scales off defensive stats and speeds up with champion or epic takedowns), a self‑regenerating magic‑absorb shield that can be held to reduce damage and force enemy attention, and multiple crowd‑control tools that displace, taunt or lift foes; a long‑reach protective intervention lets him relocate and deliver a delayed, high‑impact arrival. Strategically he provides reliable initiation and peel, sustained multi‑target disruption and zoning in clustered fights, global protective intervention for allies, and objective contest presence driven by his ability to both absorb spells and convert tankiness into offensive area threat.

name: Gangplank
rationale: Gangplank reads as a Skirmisher: a duelist-forward fighter who combines sustained basic-attack identity with long-range area control. Mechanically he orients around on‑attack throughput and environmental setup—he leverages an auto-attack augment and interactable explosives to convert single-target poke into burst and mobility resets, while earning persistent resources from takedowns that permanently enhance his toolkit. He also holds a dedicated self-sustain and cleanse allowing him to recover and re-enter fights. Strategically he supplies zone denial and tempo control: layered threat through placed explosives and a global-area bombardment that shapes engagements, creates pick and disengage windows, pressures objectives and split-push lanes, and rewards precision positioning and timing over raw stat spikes.

name: Garen
rationale: Garen is a classic Juggernaut: a straightforward melee brawler who trades mobility and ranged utility for raw durability and a single-target finishing threat. Mechanically he functions by sustaining out of combat, committing to short, decisive engages with a built-in mobility/cleanse, leveraging temporary damage mitigation and a persistent area-damage spin to dominate close-range exchanges, while a guaranteed execute on low-health foes secures kills; defensive stats grow through takedowns, reinforcing extended fights. Strategically he provides a reliable frontline anchor and duel threat that forces opponents to avoid isolation, offers consistent zone and cleanup pressure, and delivers simple, high-impact execution and damage-soaking for his team.

name: Gnar
rationale: Gnar functions as a Skirmisher who toggles between a nimble ranged harasser and a short-lived, hard-engage melee threat, fitting the class by blending hit‑and‑run trade patterns with momentary frontline disruption. Mechanically he is driven by a resource-based transformation that swaps stats and an entire toolkit, creating two distinct playmodes that reward managing Rage generation, timing form windows, and exploiting form-specific movement and interaction tools rather than relying on single-skill bursts. Strategically he offers safe poke, kiting and split-pressure in his small form and a predictable, terrain-amplified initiation and area crowd-control window in his large form, forcing teams to play around his cyclical power spikes and zoning potential.

name: Gragas
rationale: Gragas reads as a Diver: a mobile frontline initiator who commits into fights to create disruption and reposition enemies while sustaining through self-healing and damage mitigation. Mechanically he is a combo-driven brawler that blends a controllable delayed zone with a collision-based dash and a long-range displacement, rewarding timing and chaining—use mobility to engage or disengage, detonate zones to zone and burst clustered foes, and follow up with displacement to isolate or scatter targets; his damage profile includes area on-hit effects that scale with enemy bulk, reinforcing threat to tanks. Strategically he provides dependable initiation and peel, flexible engage/disengage tools, durable sustained presence in fights, strong area control and anti-clump/anti-tank pressure for coordinated teamplay.

name: Graves
rationale: Graves functions as a Skirmisher: a short-to-mid range, self-sufficient duelist who trades in bursts rather than sustained, long-range poke. Mechanically he is built around limited-ammunition burst windows and reloads that are tightly integrated with mobility, plus multi-projectile, cone-based shots and delayed area explosions that reward careful spacing and multi-hit placement. His toolkit creates both personal survivability via dash-tied defensive stacks and offense by restoring mobility on successful hits, while an obscuring smoke field grants vision control and movement impediment to shape fights. Strategically he brings high single-target and clustered-burst damage, zone denial for objective fights and picks, reliable self-peel/repositioning, and strong skirmish presence in tight corridors and side-lane duels.

name: Gwen
rationale: Gwen is a Skirmisher that excels in short-to-medium ranged duels by trading repeatedly and forcing isolated fights rather than initiating teamwide engagements. Her kit is built around empowered basic attacks that scale against enemy durability and sustain herself, layered multi‑hit and reactivatable abilities that convert portions of her damage to unavoidable damage, a mobility tool that repositions and temporarily amplifies her attack cadence and reach, and a personal protective zone that denies enemy targeting for windows. Mechanically she rewards precise sequencing—weaving empowered autos between ability activations, managing reactivations, and timing her protective window—so she functions as a self-contained duelist who shreds single targets, creates split-pressure and pick potential, provides local zoning and chase control, and converts short windows of safety into extended, high-damage skirmishes rather than offering hard engage or broad utility for the team.

name: Hecarim
rationale: Diver — Hecarim embodies a mobility-first frontline engager who commits into enemy formations to create chaos and isolate targets. Mechanically he converts movement speed into offensive power, rewards sustained close-quarters fighting through a stacking cleave that refreshes and amplifies his presence in trades, and combines area persistent damage with defensive self-healing while locked into melee. His kit trades momentary vulnerability for high-impact entries: ghosting and built-up speed let him stretch gaps and extend his basic attack into a displacing strike, while a long-range charge provides a fear-and-slow follow-through that scales with approach. Strategically he offers reliable, high-mobility initiation and disruption, durable sustained damage and self-sustain in the thick of combat, and strong map-joining and flank potential—functioning as a melee engage engine that both starts fights and punishes teams that cluster or misposition.

name: Heimerdinger
rationale: Heimerdinger functions as an Artillery Mage built around persistent, deployable damage sources rather than direct melee or mobile trading, matching an artillery/specialist archetype that controls space from range. Mechanically he centers on placing and upgrading automated defenses and area effects, using those deployables as the primary damage engines while his own actions enhance or interact with them; the kit rewards deliberate turret placement, timed ability augmentations, and positional play and even grants movement interactions tied to friendly structures. Strategically he offers sustained poke and waveclear, choke-point and objective denial, safe siege and split-push pressure, and creates engineered zones that force opponents to respect controlled space and tempo.

name: Hwei
rationale: Hwei is an Artillery Mage because his identity centers on long-range, pattern-based spells and area-denial rather than sustained melee trading. Mechanically he operates through three discrete mood states that swap his entire toolkit, with an instant mood-change signature that enables seamless, on-the-fly combinations; this creates a playstyle built on layered zoning, delayed explosions, targeted amplified strikes against isolated foes, and a mix of seeking projectiles and persistent ground effects. Strategically he supplies extended poke and siege pressure, space control and layered crowd control for objective fights, conditional single-target burst on separated enemies, and situational team utility—offensive threat, defensive shielding and movement utility—allowing him to flex between poke, peel, and pick depending on mood sequencing.

name: Illaoi
rationale: Illaoi reads as a Juggernaut: a durable, territory‑centric fighter who forces enemies to fight inside her controlled space rather than chase or kite her. Mechanically she orients around persistent, terrain‑tethered tentacles that autonomously apply pressure and grant sustain when they strike, plus a spirit‑extraction mechanic that converts champions into high‑value, vulnerable targets and spawns additional tentacles to enforce committed duels; short repositioning strikes and an empowerment phase let her briefly close gaps and amplify those tentacle hits. Strategically she delivers unskippable localized zone control and objective denial, punishes overextensions with inevitable damage and sustain, and functions as a decisive single‑target duelist and frontline anchor that forces opponents into costly, committed engagements.

name: Irelia
rationale: Skirmisher — Irelia is a mobile melee duelist built to seek, stick to, and finish priority targets through repeated short trades and chained mobility. Her kit revolves around stacking sustained offense that transforms into empowered auto-attacks, a gap-closing reset that applies on-hit effects and self-sustain, and tools that both mitigate incoming damage and create hard crowd-control windows. Mechanically she functions by weaving passively amplified basic attacks with opportunistic resets and precision-timed defensive charges, while using converging projectiles and a perimeter-forming ultimate to sculpt the battlefield. Strategically she provides high single-target threat and execution potential, reliable flank and split-pressure, and localized zone control that forces fights on her terms.

name: Ivern
rationale: Enchanter — Ivern embodies a supportive, utility-first jungle archetype: he trades traditional monster-slaying for a camp-maturation and gifting mechanic that reshapes jungle tempo. Mechanically he is a zone and topology controller who leverages deployable brush, a targeted immobilize with built-in repositioning, a protective shield that converts into AoE slow/damage, and a controllable summoned frontline to contest space. These systems synergize around enabling allies rather than maximizing personal damage—he creates vision and ambush terrain, sets up reliable picks and disengages, provides clutch peel and shields in skirmishes, and exerts sustained map pressure through objective tempo and persistent presence rather than direct DPS.

name: Janna
rationale: Janna is an Enchanter support because her core purpose is to empower and protect allies rather than duel opponents. Her mechanical identity centers on mobility- and timing-driven utility: she amplifies allied movement to enable repositioning, uses a chargeable displacement to shape space, provides a targeted, decaying protective barrier that also grants offensive amplification, and sustains teams with a channeled area heal while repelling threats. Her toolkit scales with movement-focused play and rewards precise timing of channel and charge windows to interrupt engages or enable skirmishes. Strategically she delivers reliable peel and disengage, turret and objective protection, allied mobility/enabler power for roams and kites, and teamfight zoning that reshapes enemy approach vectors.

name: Jarvan IV
rationale: Jarvan IV functions as a Diver: a committed initiator who closes onto priority targets to start fights and force decisive engagements by isolating foes with temporary terrain. Mechanically he is combo-driven around positional anchors and territorial control—he uses a deployed flag as a tether and attack-speed amplifier, a directional engage that locks into that tether to displace and interrupt, and an impact that creates a short-lived circular barrier to trap or separate enemies; he also carries an on-hit damage trait that scales off current health and a short defensive tool that slows foes and grants a shield. Strategically he is a primary engage and pick tool that shapes fights through zone denial and target isolation, enables short brawls by buffing allied attack cadence, and offers frontline presence with brief protective utility to secure objectives and force favorable team-fight setups.

name: Jax
rationale: Skirmisher: Jax is a melee duelist built to win extended one‑on‑one and small‑group fights through sustained ramping damage and targeted mobility. Mechanically he revolves around a stacking attack‑speed ramp that rewards prolonged engagement, a reliable single‑target gap closer/commit tool and an empower that converts autos into spike damage, combined with a defensive/evasive window that negates basic attacks and converts defense into area disruption. His ultimate consumes built‑up momentum to deliver bonus magic burst and a defensive AoE, making his damage profile shift from steady sustained output to concentrated payoff. Strategically he offers isolated kill pressure and split‑push threat, dependable flank and dive capability, and teamfight utility through self‑peel, area disruption, and a late‑fight damage spike when allowed extended uptime.

name: Jayce
rationale: Jayce reads as a Skirmisher because his kit is built around short, decisive confrontations that toggle between ranged harassment and melee clutching; he excels at picking favorable fights rather than prolonged frontline duties. Mechanically he is defined by stance-swapping that changes attack patterns and damage types, with a built-in mobility/reset on transformation that enables rapid repositioning, poke that weakens enemy defenses, localized zone pressure, and targeted crowd control that forces repositioning. Strategically he supplies range control and tempo: a lane bully and duel threat who shapes engagements through poke-to-all-in sequencing, creates pick and split-pressure opportunities, and provides movement and vision utility to help allies contest space without serving as a sustained tank or primary engage tool.

name: Jhin
rationale: Jhin is an Artillery Marksman who functions as a precision-focused sniper rather than a sustained auto-attacker, trading attack speed for few extremely potent shots. His mechanical identity is built around a rhythm: deliberate, high-impact bullets with a guaranteed amplified finisher, tempo-dependent mobility tied to precision hits, and a toolkit that layers long-range poke, planted trap zones and a multi-shot finishing volley to control space. Strategically he supplies long-range pick and siege pressure, zone denial and setup for allied follow-up, reliable single-target execution from safety, and tempo control through timed burst windows that force opponents to respect his firing arcs and trapfields.

name: Jinx
rationale: Marksman with artillery instincts: Jinx functions as a ranged damage carry who trades mobility for overwhelming sustained and burst physical output from two distinct firing modes and a long-range execute. Mechanically she is built around weapon-swapping and momentum—one mode rewards rapid firing and stacking for extended DPS while the other trades resources for area-piercing reach—combined with a reset-on-takedown mechanic that grants sudden mobility and attack-rate amplification. Strategically she provides reliable siege and cleanup power, long-range poke and execute threat that punishes low-health targets, zone control through deployed traps and slows, and the ability to convert kills or structural picks into extended map pressure and rapid teamfight follow-ups.

name: K'Sante
rationale: K'Sante reads as a hybrid Warden/Skirmisher: a durable frontline who also excels in short-range duels. Mechanically he layers temporary marks and stacked strikes into empowered consumption hits, trades in a preparatory defensive stance that grants situational damage reduction and a recast window, and leverages targeted mobility with a shield that can extend to allies and traverse terrain. His ultimate provides single-target lockdown, a positional reset and a transformation into a more aggressive close‑quarters breaker. Strategically he brings reliable peel and disruption, dependable single‑target lockdown for picks, hard engage windows and resilient brawling that anchors skirmishes and controls flanks.

name: Kai'Sa
rationale: Kai'Sa is a Marksman whose identity fuses hybrid burst and skirmishing through an adaptive, evolving kit. Mechanically she centers on applying and stacking a short-duration mark that amplifies follow-up damage while her core abilities scale and transform as she grows, enabling a shift from ranged poke to high single-target burst and sustained on-hit pressure. The kit prioritizes mid-range harassment that reveals space, a brief stealth window for repositioning, and a targeted, shielded dash for aggressive entries and safe extraction. Strategically she brings reliable pick and assassination potential, flexible damage profiles that punish isolated targets, strong small-team skirmish carry power, and opportunistic lane pressure and scouting utility.

name: Kalista
rationale: Kalista functions as a Marksman-skirmisher: a ranged, attack-driven duelist who excels at extended kiting and single-target takedowns. Mechanically she rewards precise attack timing and movement execution—her basic strikes are linked to short, attack-timed traversals and an uninterruptible windup that enables mid-windup retargeting—while her kit layers persistent spear stacks via attacks and a piercing projectile that can transfer stacks, which are then consumed for high single-target execute and a brief slow. She also brings a tether-based ally interaction that temporarily removes, cleanses, and repositions a teammate and an autonomous vision patrol. Strategically she supplies sustained kiting damage, reliable execute pressure for objectives and picks, strong repositioning playmaking and peel through ally control, and demands coordinated positioning and attack-weaving to maximize impact.

name: Karma
rationale: Karma is an Enchanter support: her identity is centered on adaptive utility rather than raw sustained damage, combining shields, movement modifiers, and single-target control to empower allies and shape fights. Mechanically she orbits a timed empower that alters her basic spells and a passive that rewards landing damaging abilities by accelerating access to that empower, which forces a play pattern of measured poke and well-timed empowered casts. She provides short-to-medium range area control and a tether-based lockdown that rewards sustained focus for a root and follow-up heal, while her empowered defensive cast spreads protection and mobility. Strategically Karma brings layered peel and poke, reliable zone control for objective fights, flexible engage/disengage leverage, and a toolkit that amplifies allies and creates single-target pick windows without committing to hard initiation.

name: Karthus
rationale: An Artillery Mage that functions as a persistent, high-impact caster, Karthus trades mobility for extended-area and map-spanning magic damage, operating as a stationary damage engine and late-fight finisher. His identity centers on sustaining an aura that pressures nearby foes at the cost of his own resources and remaining a lethal presence after death, enabling continued spellcasting and a global finishing strike. Mechanically he emphasizes zone control through delayed, often single-target-amplified blasts, resource-management tradeoffs, and a death-state that preserves offensive output. Strategically he delivers reliable waveclear and teamfight DPS, punishes low-health targets across the map, and forces opponents to respect persistent zoning and unavoidable long-range threat.

name: Kassadin
rationale: Kassadin is an Assassin who embodies a mobile burst-mage assassin: he excels at closing short gaps to delete priority targets and escape immediately, fitting the Assassin class through backline penetration and high single-target threat. Mechanically he centers on a blink-based loop that scales with repeated uses, combined with an empowered basic-attack resource interaction and built-in anti-magic defenses; his kit alternates between aggressive repositioning, brief survivability, and concentrated magic burst. Strategically he supplies pick-and-flank pressure, reliable roams and split threat, and a direct counter to magic-reliant enemies through innate mobility and damage mitigation, shaping team fights by forcing isolated engagements.

name: Katarina
rationale: Katarina is an Assassin: she specializes in rapid, close-range execution of high-value targets through extreme mobility and reset-driven play. Mechanically she orbits a dagger-placement and teleportation loop—positioning to retrieve or leap to dagger locations and enemy units enables chained engagements; kills or timely takedowns dramatically reduce her ability cooldowns, rewarding multi-target resets and aggressive re-entry. Strategically she brings reliable single-target burst and chaotic, reset-fueled teamfight skirmishing: she can dive into clustered fights to convert resets into multi-kills, punish mispositioning, threaten flanks, and manipulate wave and space control through area dagger interactions, forcing opponents to commit focused attention.

name: Kayle
rationale: Kayle functions as an Artillery Mage: a time- and level-driven ranged carry whose identity is built around a progressive transformation from fragile melee to a high-range, empowered auto-attacker. Mechanically she trades early safety for a deterministic growth path—her baseline evolves into extended reach, stacked onboard power and on-hit magical augmentation with area wave effects, supported by a targeted heal that grants mobility and a timed invulnerability that enables clutch plays. She emphasizes sustained single-target and area DPS, zoning via extended attack reach and slows, and utility through a temporary defensive window and enemy defensive reduction. Strategically she brings reliable late-game sustained damage and siege/split-push presence plus a local sustain-and-save tool that lets teams commit to high-value engages.

name: Kayn
rationale: Kayn is a Skirmisher: a mobile melee duelist built to enter fights from unconventional angles and contest single targets. Mechanically he centers on a momentum-driven transformation that permanently defines how he trades—pairing directional mobility, area sweeps and a vanish-and-reshadow finishing tool with terrain traversal that rewards creative pathing and on-contact sustain. His kit prioritizes stickiness and assassination windows over raw front-line durability, enabling repeated entry and exit during skirmishes. Strategically he provides flank pressure, reliable single-target elimination and objective contesting through map mobility, able to pivot between extended dueling or focused burst execution depending on his completed form.

name: Kennen
rationale: Kennen reads as an Artillery Mage: a spell-focused ranged skirmisher whose kit creates layered zone control and multi-target burst rather than prolonged single-target brawling. Mechanically he is built around applying transient marks through spells and empowered basic attacks and then detonating those marks to stun and refresh resources, so play revolves around weaving abilities and hits in precise sequences, using a short-duration lightning form for repositioning and touch-based sustenance, and leveraging a channeled area storm that pulses repeated lightning strikes. Strategically he supplies reliable multi-target disruption and zone denial for teamfights and objective control, functioning as a combo-driven engager/peeler who can poke, force flanks, and convert stacked burst into decisive crowd-control windows.

name: Kha'Zix
rationale: Kha'Zix reads as an Assassin — a predator designed to hunt and delete isolated foes rather than sustain prolonged frontline fights. Mechanically he revolves around isolation-amplified damage, stealth-enabled empowered openers, and high mobility for gap closing and repositioning; his toolkit rewards approaching from fog-of-war or invisibility to secure focused burst and then re-enter fights through a short invisibility window that permits a secondary engagement. Strategically he provides reliable single-target pick threat and skirmish dominance, reshaping fights by punishing poor positioning and vision, exerting map pressure through split-target threat and rapid collapse rather than sustained area control or team-frontline durability.

name: Kindred
rationale: Kindred is a Marksman defined by a hunt-first identity: a dual-entity ranged damage dealer whose long-term power is earned by marking and eliminating targets. Mechanically they operate as a mobile, stacking skirmisher that accumulates permanent hunt charges from designated targets, trading short-term fights for growing global efficacy; their kit blends leap-and‑poke mobility, attack-speed and projectile-based trading, on‑attack healing windows, and a stacking execute that rewards focused follow‑up. Strategic value lies in objective and single‑target control—they pressure and snowball through targeted elimination, provide clutch area-level survivability and zoning for allies, and excel at sustained duels, kiting and split-threat play that converts hunt progress into lasting map leverage.

name: Kled
rationale: Kled reads as a Diver-skirmisher: a committed melee initiator who forces contact and won’t easily disengage once he commits. Mechanically he is defined by a mount/dismount resource that changes his mobility and survivability, an empowered basic-attack sequence that rewards sustained close-range trading, and mobility tools that mark, tether, drag and ultimately charge into fights—providing both single-target stickiness and disruptive displacement. Strategically he functions as a primary engage and pick engine that creates decisive skirmishes: he isolates and displaces priority targets, soaks and trades at the front line, and provides high-momentum map pressure via a long-range, team-enabled charge that accelerates allied follow-up and snowballing fights.

name: Kog'Maw
rationale: Kog'Maw reads as an Artillery Mage–style marksman who specializes in extreme-range sustained damage and siege pressure. Mechanically he forces engagements around empowered basic attacks and timed attack windows that trade fragility for reach: his kit extends and converts auto-attacks into long-range, max-health–scaling magic damage while offering brief attack-speed amplification and tools to shape enemy positioning with a slowing area and long-range artillery poke. Strategically he serves as a rearline damage engine and objective shaper—punishing overextensions, melting high-health targets over time, enabling safe poke-and-siege play, and providing a delayed, unavoidable explosive death effect that can decisively influence skirmishes and zone control.

name: LeBlanc
rationale: LeBlanc functions as an Assassin — a short-duration burst mage whose core role is killing priority targets through rapid, deceptive trades. Her mechanical identity centers on combo sequencing and illusion manipulation: she layers a mark to amplify follow-up spells, rewinds positional options with a teleport that leaves a return, amplifies her last used tool via a mimic, and deploys fake cues to confuse opponents. This kit rewards precise timing, conditional commits, and baiting opponents into misreads. Strategically she provides high single-target pick potential, lane-roam and skirmish pressure, and an outplay-oriented in-and-out playstyle that trades sustained presence for sudden, decisive burst and deception.

name: Lee Sin
rationale: Diver — Lee Sin embodies the diver archetype through aggressive, short-range engagement and high personal mobility that lets him enter fights, trade, and exit on his own terms. Mechanically he functions as a mark-and-dash skirmisher that chains skillshots and targeted dashes into bursty single-target follow-ups, augmented by an attack-speed–based passive and a temporary sustain window that reward extended trades. His kit trades range for precision: tools to reveal and mark targets, a mobility toolkit that repositions him or allies, area-marking that enables follow-up crowd control, and a displacement ultimate that both isolates targets and creates impactful teamfight chaos. Strategically he is a proactive playmaker and strong duelist who supplies isolation and pick potential, reliable gank and flank pressure, objective threat through single-target removal/forced repositioning, and situational peel via ally protection—serving as a high-skill champion that converts mechanical sequencing into outsized tactical leverage.

name: Leona
rationale: Leona is a Warden — a front-line, hard-engage support who specializes in locking down targets and absorbing damage for her team. Mechanically she is a commitment-driven initiator that layers brief, high-impact control windows with ally-enabled damage: she applies persistent marks that allow teammates to amplify burst, uses a targeted dash and proc-stun to close and pin priority targets, and sacrifices mobility flexibility for extended, reliable crowd control backed by a defensive stance that converts durability into an area disruptive detonation. Strategically she offers dependable initiation, layered peel and zone denial—creating framed windows for allied follow-up, winning short skirmishes, anchoring teamfights, and enabling coordinated target execution through chained CC and marked-target synergies.

name: Lillia
rationale: Lillia reads as a Skirmisher: a mobile, AP-centered duelist who shapes fights through sustained area pressure rather than single-hit burst. Mechanically she centers on applying a persistent mark that deals percent‑health damage and heals her, combined with wide sweeping attacks, a rolling skillshot that slows and reveals, and a mobility strike that lets her reposition into optimal impact zones; her finishing tool converts marked enemies into a brief sleep that rewards follow‑up damage. Strategically she supplies prolonged AoE burn against frontlines, reliable objective and wave pressure through damage-over-time, strong flank and kiting potential, and single-target pick setups via slows, reveal, and the sleep-window for coordinated burst.

name: Lissandra
rationale: Lissandra is an Artillery Mage: she excels at long-range initiation and layered area denial through persistent, autonomous ice threats and heavy crowd control. Mechanically she builds and controls evolving zones—placing untargetable pursuers that slow and detonate, firing piercing projectiles that widen and extend, projecting a reactivatable ice tether for repositioning, and offering a versatile ultimate that either locks down an enemy or self-entombs for protection and sustain. Her play relies on sequencing these tools to chain immobilization, punish mispositioning, and convert pokes into picks; she sacrifices constant mobility for powerful, commit-heavy crowd control. Strategically she supplies reliable single-target lockdown and multi-target suppression, objective zoning, siege control, and both initiation and peel in teamfights.

name: Lucian
rationale: Lucian is a Marksman defined by rapid, short-window trades and high mobility. His kit enforces an ability-weave rhythm—casts automatically trigger a follow-up basic attack—so mastery revolves around timing abilities to layer empowered autos for sustained single-target pressure. He uses linear poke and marking projectiles to pressure and track enemies from range while a quick dash lets him constantly repoint, dodge, and maintain optimal spacing. His channeled, forward-facing barrage converts that weaving into a prolonged execution tool for fleeing or isolated targets. Strategically he supplies consistent, precision-focused ranged damage, lane dominance and skirmish-winning capacity, excelling at hit-and-run trades, target pressure, and pursuit.

name: Lulu
rationale: Lulu is an Enchanter support because her kit prioritizes ally empowerment, protection, and soft crowd control over raw damage. Mechanically she orbits a persistent faerie companion that augments basic attacks and can be redeployed to allies or enemies to shift where pressure lands; this is paired with long‑range poke and slows, a versatile single‑target disable that can instead grant offensive buffs, and a targeted protective empowerment that increases survivability while generating a local zoning aura. Strategically she offers reliable lane harassment and sustained peel, enabling carries through shields, attack‑speed and mobility boosts, tempo control via slows and disruption, and a teamfight safety net that turns focused aggression into controlled skirmishes.

name: Lux
rationale: Artillery Mage — Lux functions as a long-range poke and zoning caster whose identity centers on projecting control and burst from safety. Mechanically she leverages a mark-and-consume rhythm: her spells tag foes and are amplified by targeted follow-up, rewarding skillshot hits, timed detonations and ability sequencing while sacrificing mobility for extended reach. The kit blends single-target lockdown, persistent area threats, a defensive shield that projects outward and returns, and a high‑impact linear ultimate that punishes poor positioning and provides brief vision. Strategically she provides reliable poke, area denial and pick setup, layered burst for focused targets, protective utility for allies, and teamfight shaping from a backline posture.

name: Malphite
rationale: Malphite reads as a Diver — a heavy engage tank whose mechanical purpose is to close distance reliably and convert his bulk into disruptive initiation. His kit centers on self-scaling survivability via a health-tied, regenerating shield and layered armor buffs that let him absorb frontline punishment, while tools that slow and deal localized area damage enable short trades and zone control. The signature, displacement-immune engage delivers concentrated AoE disruption and airborne crowd control to lock targets in place. Strategically he functions as a primary initiator and space-controller: forcing teamfights on favorable terms, creating windows for allied follow-up, isolating high-value targets, and serving as a durable front line that trades durability for decisive, short-duration crowd-control pressure.

name: Malzahar
rationale: Malzahar is an Artillery Mage: a long-range control caster that prioritizes zoning, sustained pressure, and single-target lockdown over mobility. His mechanical identity centers on applying a persistent damage-over-time affliction that is refreshed by his disruptive spells, building an internal void resource while casting that can be consumed to spawn autonomous attackers; he also intermittently gains a protective status that mitigates damage and status effects until broken by enemy hits. He trades mobility for safety and layered control—long-range silence, area denial and a channeled suppression that locks and reveals a target. Strategically he supplies reliable pick and execution potential, waveclear and objective pressure via summoned minions, and durable zoning and peel for allies rather than serving as a primary engager or roamer.

name: Maokai
rationale: Maokai is a Warden — a durable frontline controller that defines space through disruptive crowd control and sustained presence. Mechanically he blends on-hit sustain that scales with spell interactions, a targeted untargetable gap-close for guaranteed single-target lockdown, short-range displacement and slows for peel and disruption, autonomous scout/projectile units that patrol and punish approach paths, and a sweeping advancing wall that enforces zoning and roots. Those elements combine into a kit built around layered lockdown, area denial, and survivable initiation: he initiates and anchors fights, chains reliable CC to lock priority targets or protect allies, and controls objective and lane terrain to shape teamfights.

name: Master Yi
rationale: Skirmisher — a melee duelist built around sustained single-target combat and takedown-driven momentum. Mechanically he stacks and consumes layered hits to amplify individual strikes, uses a brief evasive/targeted multi-hit to apply on-hit effects and reposition, temporarily converts attacks into high-impact damage bursts, and gains potent mobility, attack-speed and crowd-control immunity when he secures kills. He also has a channel that provides burst self-healing, damage mitigation, and passive stack generation. This kit emphasizes stacking, on‑hit interaction, takedown resets, and risk-reward windows where vulnerability is exchanged for extreme sustained DPS. Strategically he provides reliable single-target hunting, clean-up and split-pressure, strong chase/escape through brief invulnerability and cleansing, and a snowballing duelist role that punishes isolated targets and extended skirmishes.

name: Mel
rationale: Mel reads as an Artillery Mage: a long‑range spellcaster who shapes fights with skillshot poke, zone control and decisive burst. Mechanically she accumulates a stacked resource on enemies via spells and attacks that stores escalating magic damage and converts sustained pressure into executes—either passively when stacks become lethal or through a concentrated detonation—while a brief defensive window that grants invulnerability to most damage plus a mobility boost lets her reposition safely to maintain uptime. Strategically she compresses poke, crowd control and area denial into a single role: she sieges and zones, locks and punishes priority targets, and transforms layered pressure into multi‑target finishes and teamfight swing potential.

name: Milio
rationale: Enchanter — Milio embodies a support enchanter who augments allies rather than dealing damage directly, because his toolkit centers on empowering teammate actions, providing shields, heals, cleanses, movement utility, and extended attack reach. Mechanically he functions around an ally-enchantment layer that causes allied offensive actions to trigger secondary ignitions and lingering burns, combined with a guided displacement projectile that creates pick-and-peel opportunities and area slow; he also deploys a mobile flame sentinel that trails allies to extend their range and stream healing, plus stockpiled defensive barriers and an AoE restorative exhalation that removes certain crowd control and raises tenacity. Strategically he supplies sustained teamfight survivability, proactive peel and counter-engage tools, tempo control through ranged threat and zoning, and amplifies skirmish and objective trades by turning ally autos and abilities into amplified, protectable follow-up damage and sustain.

name: Miss Fortune
rationale: Miss Fortune is a Marksman with an artillery-style identity—she functions as a precision ranged DPS who specializes in layered area and directional damage rather than sustained melee skirmishes. Mechanically she centers on rewarding target selection and timing: a mark-based on-hit engine that amplifies damage when hitting fresh targets, a ricochet/poke dimension that spreads on-hit effects, a movement-speed steroid that incentivizes careful downtime and aggressive repositioning, and large-area and channeled cone damage tools that shape fights. Strategically she delivers lane pressure and objective control through poke and wave manipulation, strong zoning and angled teamfight execution with high cone/AoE burst windows, and reliable kiting and peel when positioned correctly, making her a team’s primary ranged damage and zoning toolkit that trades mobility for empowered, timing-dependent volleys.

name: Mordekaiser
rationale: Mordekaiser is a Juggernaut — a heavy, self-sustaining frontliner and single-target duelist who enforces prolonged fights through applied pressure and enforced isolation. His mechanical identity revolves around sustained melee stacking that converts into an area-pressure state, a damage-capture shield economy that turns offense and incoming damage into temporary protection, and deterministic tools that reveal, pull, and banish enemies while temporarily siphoning their offensive and defensive attributes to amplify himself. Strategically he delivers dependable frontline sustain and objective control, punishes isolated priority targets, creates reliable windows to remove enemies from engagements, and excels in extended trades and split engagements where durability, percent-based sustained damage and zoning dictate tempo.

name: Morgana
rationale: Morgana functions as an Artillery Mage whose toolkit centers on long-range pick, area denial, and protective utility: she fits the class by delivering threatening single-target snares and lingering ground pressure from a distance while also offering a defensive shield that alters enemy crowd-control windows. Mechanically she is a control-and-trade mage that punishes positioning, sustains through damage-to-heal interactions, and sequences a catch-then-zone rhythm—land a bind, force enemies into persistent ground damage and proximity threats, and time shields to enable aggression or peel. Strategically she brings reliable pick potential, persistent teamfight zoning and objective control, anti-CC protection for carries, and a playmaking presence that forces opponents to respect positional constraints.

name: Naafiri
rationale: Naafiri is a Skirmisher because she specializes in close-range isolation and sustained dueling rather than long-range zoning or front-line durability. Mechanically she operates as a pack-centered melee skirmisher: her identity leans on summoned companions that mirror and amplify her aggression, a repeatable pressure tool for multi-target harassment, a gap-closing angled strike that culminates in an area burst, and a coordinated mark-and-dash that consolidates focus on a single victim; her kit rewards chained aggression and converts successful strikes and takedowns into renewed offensive tempo. Strategically she brings reliable pick-and-chase pressure, excels at collapsing on isolated carries and winning short trades, and functions as a mobile threat that forces opponents to respect flanks and limits safe positioning, trading sustained teamfight front-line control for lethal close-range ambush and objective contesting capability.

name: Nami
rationale: Nami is an Enchanter: her design centers on empowering allies, providing sustain, and enabling movement in fights while also offering selective crowd control. Mechanically she functions as a timing-and-positioning support who links skillshot CC, a bouncing heal/damage effect that alternates targets, and an on-hit empowerment that turns allied attacks and abilities into chase-or-trade tools; her kit rewards landing spells on allies and sequencing buffs and CC to create follow-up windows. Strategically she supplies lane sustain and enhanced trades, reliable peel and pick setup through single-target suspension and frontal displacement, wave and zone control in teamfights, and systemic mobility enablement that turns allied strengths into coordinated engagements and disengages.

name: Nasus
rationale: Nasus reads as a Skirmisher — a melee scaling duelist who transitions from lane bully to frontline brawler. His mechanical identity is built around a permanent, empowerable basic attack that grows stronger with sustained farming and takedowns, complemented by innate sustain that rewards extended trades. He enforces single-target control with a crippling, decaying slow and exerts area denial and armor reduction through a lingering ground zone, while a timed transformation dramatically boosts his bulk, reach, attack cadence, and adds a percentage-based aura of damage. Strategically he provides disciplined split-push and objective pressure, reliable isolation of priority targets, durable frontline presence in prolonged fights, and simple, high-ceiling carry potential that scales with time and uptime.

name: Nautilus
rationale: Nautilus is a Warden: a heavily armoured frontline engager whose identity centers on hard crowd control and space control. Mechanically he operates by chaining layered displacement and lock-down—a gap‑closing/terrain interaction to initiate, a passively applied on‑hit root to punish targets who try to escape, area slows for zoning, sustained defensive sustain that converts his attacks into persistent area pressure, and a pursuing ultimate that singles out and amplifies CC on a primary target. Strategically he provides reliable hard engage and peel, single‑target pick potential, disruptive frontline presence that dictates enemy positioning, and consistent objective and teamfight zoning through timed chains of lockdown.

name: Neeko
rationale: Neeko functions as an Artillery Mage because her core play centers on ranged, area-focused magic damage and layered crowd control rather than sustained trading or auto-attack dueling. Mechanically she is built around deception and burst sequencing: a persistent disguise and clone system that creates ambiguity and enables surprise engages, a stacking on-hit mechanic that converts a basic attack into an empowered strike with mobility, area spells that can re-trigger on kills to chain burst across multiple targets, and a skillshot-driven root that strengthens with successful hits plus a telegraphed, high-impact area knockup/stun ultimate. Strategically she provides pick potential and deceptive lane pressure, reliable siege and waveclear through repeatable AoE bursts, and heavy teamfight zoning and follow-up CC—rewarding setups, flanks, and coordinated crowd-control chains rather than isolated sustained damage.

name: Nidalee
rationale: Nidalee is a Specialist because her identity is built around two fundamentally different combat modes she must switch between to be effective: long‑range, prediction‑based poke and trap/utility play versus short‑range, high‑movement melee execution. Mechanically she revolves around form swaps that let her layer distant skillshot pressure, concealed area control and targeted sustain with an alternate kit that prizes mobility, empowered basic attacks and gap‑closing leaps; success depends on chaining ranged harassment and vision denial into safe closes or disengages using cougar mobility. Strategically she supplies long‑range pick and zone control, isolated target hunting and skirmish conversion, plus niche sustain/attack‑speed support—rewarding precision, map awareness and timing when committing to melee engagements.

name: Nilah
rationale: Nilah reads as a Skirmisher: a mobile, melee duelist who excels in close-range exchanges and sustained fights while uniquely amplifying the survivability of an adjacent ally. Mechanically she converts offensive investment into effective penetration, heals herself from champion damage and transforms excess healing into a short-lived personal buffer, while relying on charge-limited gap-closing mobility and a brief evasive movement that can be transferred to allies on contact to create a shared protective window. Her kit also supplies localized disruption and a damage-to-heal conversion that benefits nearby teammates. Strategically she delivers lane-level partnership and localized teamfight leverage—enabling aggressive coordinated engages, creating frontline pressure and pick threat, improving ally sustain and peel in close-quarter skirmishes, and forcing opponents to respect a high-mobility, self-sustaining melee presence that trades favorably in protracted brawls when supported by positional coordination.

name: Nocturne
rationale: Nocturne reads as an Assassin/Diver: a champion designed to close gaps quickly and eliminate priority targets through committed engagement rather than extended teamfighting. Mechanically he is built around shadow mobility and conditional offensive spikes—he creates and uses traversal paths and a targeted dash to ignore zoning and reach backline carries, while short-burst attack empowerment, attack-speed windows and on-hit sustain let him trade aggressively in short skirmishes. His kit rewards timing and isolation, with defensive counters that convert into increased offensive tempo and a persistent crowd-control tether that punishes failure to break contact. Strategically he provides reliable pick threat, forces repositioning via vision denial, and serves as a flank-oriented initiator and single-target execution tool that thrives in skirmish-heavy compositions.

name: Nunu
rationale: Nunu & Willump embody a Warden: a durable, disruptive frontline built to protect allies, deny space and initiate fights. Mechanically the kit revolves around high‑commitment positioning and timing—momentum-based gapclosing that grants forced CC while bypassing slows, a holdable channel that must be timed to detonate for maximum disruption, a self-sustaining bite that doubles as reliable objective execution, and short projectile stacks that apply crowd-control effects; a team‑wide tempo passive rewards dealing damage to key targets by temporarily boosting ally movement and attack speed, prioritizing the quickest attacker. Strategically, Nunu delivers consistent initiation and zoning, objective control and monster security, frontline peel via shielding and slows, and tempo tools that set up and finish fights when his channels and engages land.

name: Olaf
