rationale: Olaf is a Skirmisher — a brute-force melee duelist who excels at committed, auto-attack–forward fights and thrives when exchanges become dangerous. Mechanically he converts vulnerability into power: his offense and sustain scale as his health declines, he manages a thrown-axe resource for ranged poke and cooldown manipulation, and his execute trades health for guaranteed damage and potential healing while basic attacks accelerate his finish window. His ultimate grants temporary CC immunity and tankiness to force dives. Strategically he brings dependable single-target kill pressure and objective contention, strong stick-to-target play, simple armor-reduction utility for focused fights, and a reliable way to ignore crowd control to close or finish skirmishes.

name: Orianna
rationale: Artillery Mage — Orianna functions as a mid-range control mage whose identity is built around a single mobile tool (the Ball) that extends her spells. Mechanically she is defined by commanding that companion: all offense, defense and crowd control are delivered through its position, so play revolves around pre‑positioning the Ball, timing its movement to avoid interrupting her own casts, and weaving basic attacks to amplify her spell damage. Strategically she provides layered zone control and teamfight engine power: reliable mid-range poke and wave management, a protective transferable shield and mobility buff for allies, and a decisive area pull/stun that allows her to set up engages, peel, and win clustered fights when the Ball is correctly placed.

name: Ornn
rationale: Ornn is a Warden — a front-line disruption tank that anchors fights by shaping space and imposing hard displacement rather than by high mobility. Mechanically he centers on long-range, comboable disruption: terrain creation and collision-driven knockups with a recast redirect produce predictable windows for follow-up, while a brittle application amplifies subsequent crowd control and damage. Beyond raw CC, he offers a unique non-combat support role by forging Masterwork upgrades for himself and allies and enabling purchases from afar, turning individual scaling into team utility. Strategically he provides reliable initiation, peel, siege denial and objective control through positional dominance and durable engagement tools.

name: Pantheon
rationale: Diver — Pantheon is a short-range, commit-heavy engager who specializes in single-target initiation and follow-through. His kit revolves around stacking a resource that empowers his next basic ability, a wind-up long-range poke that can be recast, a targeted leap that interrupts and converts into rapid multi-hit autos, a directional shield-channel that blocks enemy damage while projecting a damaging cone, and a high-impact descent that creates area slow and a travelling shockwave on arrival. Mechanically he alternates between charged ranged pressure and brute close-quarters commitment, trading mobility for burst and survivability during his channel. Strategically he provides reliable pick initiation, selective frontline durability, lane-bully trading tools, and global pressure for cross-map skirmishes and coordinated engages.

name: Poppy
rationale: Poppy reads as a Warden: a durable front-line disruptor whose identity is built around space control, interruption and single-target containment rather than raw ranged damage. Mechanically she weaves together a returned projectile that rewards precision with a temporary health-scaled barrier, a ground-targeted impact that creates a slow field and a repeating rupture, a passive defensive buffet that amplifies survivability and emits an anti-mobility aura, a carry-forward dash that converts movement into a terrain-pin, and a charged, long-range knockback with a windup. Strategically she supplies immutable anti-mobility and peel, reliable terrain-based lockdown and single-target denial, predictable teamfight timing and objective zone control while anchoring the front line and enabling allied follow-up.

name: Pyke
rationale: Pyke reads as an Assassin: a mobility-first finisher designed to single out and remove isolated targets rather than sustain prolonged fights. Mechanically he blends stealth-based approach tools with a directional reposition that creates a brief area stun and a skillshot harpoon with an empowered recast for hard picks, while converting incoming damage into a recoverable resource that can be consumed from concealment and trading bonus survivability into offensive power. Strategically he provides high single-target execution and roam playmaking, enabling fast picks and snowballing skirmishes, forcing opponents to respect flanks and short windows of vulnerability, and rewarding precise timing and coordination.

name: Qiyana
rationale: Assassin — Qiyana functions as a high-mobility, high-burst melee assassin who specializes in single-target execution and short-window skirmishes, fitting the assassin archetype through her emphasis on rapid gap-closing and lethal combos. Mechanical identity — her kit revolves around claiming nearby terrain to temporarily empower basic attacks and spells, creating conditional ability transforms and resets that reward proactive positioning and map-awareness; she layers a mobility dash for approach, a directional strike that becomes augmented when empowered, and an ultimate that manipulates space and displaces enemies. Strategic function — she provides acute threat-making: isolating and eliminating priority targets, forcing fights around terrain, enabling opportunistic roams and picks, and offering zone control and disruption through terrain-triggered crowd movement rather than sustained frontline presence.

name: Quinn
rationale: Quinn is a Skirmisher — a mobile, single-target duelist that prioritizes hit-and-run trades and high roam potential. Her kit is built around applying and consuming a Vulnerable mark to amplify basic attacks and make spell-weave combos rewarding, producing a repeated on‑hit burst rhythm that prizes proper attack-timing. She pairs strong mobility and a temporary transformed movement state that grants extended map traversal with targeted disruption and vision-denial tools, trading sustained multi-target control for rapid isolation and displacement. Strategically she supplies dependable pick-and-execute pressure, lane bullying and split-map tempo: isolating priority targets, collapsing or disengaging skirmishes, and converting roams into objective and territorial advantage.

name: Rakan
rationale: Rakan reads as a Skirmisher with strong enchanter undertones: a mobile playmaker built to dart into fights, initiate picks, and thread protection between allies. Mechanically he is defined by layered movement and conditional survivability — a regenerating personal barrier that rewards offensive engagement, self-sustain from targeted poke, a two-stage ally shield/reposition mechanic, and an unblockable, collision-driven mobility window that applies crowd control while moving through enemies. The kit prioritizes timing and sequencing over raw damage, rewarding players who weave pokes to refresh defenses and chain-positioning tools to lock targets. Strategically, Rakan supplies reliable primary engage and pick potential, lightweight peel and single-target protection, roaming pressure to create numbers advantages, and disruptive front-line presence that enables skirmishes and flank-driven teamfight openings.

name: Rammus
rationale: Diver — Rammus functions as a tanky engager who commits into fights to disrupt priority targets and absorb punishment. Mechanically he marries high-mobility initiation with a defensive-damage rhythm: he uses gap-closing and long-range approaches to force contact, then converts raw defenses into offensive threat through on-hit spell damage and reflection while adopting a protective stance that increases his survivability and retaliation. His toolkit emphasizes single-target provocation, area disruption on impact, and self-buffed attack cadence to maintain pressure once engaged. Strategically he provides reliable primary engage and peel, strong frontline durability and objective control, zone denial through impactful collisions and slows, and a punish for poorly positioned or auto-attack–reliant enemies, shaping fights by forcing targets into disadvantageous proximity.

name: Rek'Sai
rationale: Skirmisher: functions as a mobile, single-target duelist and map-pressure jungler who excels at hunting isolated targets and contesting objectives. Mechanical identity: built around stance-swapping and resource cycling — a short-lived Fury bar that fuels sustain and an empowered bite when managed, a burrowed state that trades range for stealth-like detection and sustain, and persistent tunnels that create unorthodox mobility corridors; additionally she marks targets to enable a displacement-immune, targeted pounce that finishes based on missing health. Strategic function: provides reliable pick and execute threat, sustained dueling and objective contest tools, lane pressure through unexpected rotations and tracking, and localized disruption on re-emergence to force favorable engagements.

name: Rell
rationale: Rell is a Warden because her toolkit is built around tanky frontline initiation and multi-target crowd control that locks space and protects allies. Mechanically she toggles between a mobile mounted stance and a zone-controlling dismounted stance, layers a persistent resistance-reducing debuff that both weakens enemies and is converted into her own defenses and damage, and combines shield-destruction with routine stuns, displacements, a tethered pull and a standing damaging field. Strategically she functions as a reliable engage and disruption engine: she opens fights, punishes clustered opponents, denies space around objectives, provides frontline peel and ally mobility, and converts enemy durability into sustained frontline presence for her team.

name: Renata Glasc
rationale: Renata Glasc reads as an Enchanter-Disruptor support: she combines ally-focused protection and empowerment with disruptive crowd-control and repositioning to shape engagements. Mechanically she centers on applying a consumable damage-amplifying mark that coordinates allied follow-up, enabling windows for concentrated burst or sustained DPS, while offering a targeted lockdown and forcible displacement to pick or isolate priorities. Her kit further grants conditional offensive empowerment that refreshes on takedowns plus area shielding and slow, creating layered safety for commits. Strategically she brings pick potential, allied DPS enablement and aggressive windows, reliable peel and protective utility, and strong teamfight manipulation through zoning and forced enemy disarray.

name: Renekton
rationale: Renekton is a Diver — a melee bruiser designed to close gaps, lock down priority targets, and contest frontline space through committed short-range engagements. Mechanically he revolves around a Fury resource that builds in combat and temporarily empowers his next ability, incentivizing burst windows and aggressive trades; his kit layers repeated mobility and gap-closing tools with a built-in interrupt/stun and self-sustain, while a transformative ultimate spikes his bulk, reach, and area presence with a damaging aura. Strategically he provides reliable single-target kill pressure and initiation in short, decisive skirmishes, lane dominance through sustained trades and healing, and a frontline zoning/peel role when transformed that forces opponents to respect close-range threat.

name: Rengar
rationale: Rengar is a Skirmisher: a mobile, single-target melee hunter built to stalk and burst isolated opponents. Mechanically he revolves around a stacking resource that empowers a next ability into an extra cast and a brief movement surge, enabling combos that mix empowered auto-attacks with on-demand utility and gap closure. His toolkit trades prolonged sustained damage for concentrated short-window burst and conversion of recent damage into self-healing, while offering a targeted slow/reveal and a camouflage stalking state that locks vision on a chosen foe. Strategically he brings reliable single-target assassination and dueling, pick pressure and jungle/lane skirmish dominance through stealth-based initiation and isolation control.

name: Riven
rationale: Riven reads as a Skirmisher: a high-mobility melee duelist built for short, decisive trades and isolated confrontations rather than prolonged sieges. Mechanically she revolves around chaining a limited-resource offensive passive with a multi-cast combo toolkit that mixes burst damage, displacement and short dashes with a defensive dash-shield and a brief stun—then a temporary empowerment that lengthens reach and grants a long-range execute. Her play is combo- and timing-oriented, rewarding animation-cancels, precise charge management and positional windows to convert mobility into damage. Strategically she offers pick and flank pressure, reliable single-target kill threat and split-push/duel dominance, while supplying localized disruption and a safety buffer in melee engagements.

name: Rumble
rationale: Rumble fits the Artillery Mage archetype because he specializes in sustained close-to-mid-range area damage and persistent zoning that controls enemy movement rather than pure single-target burst. His mechanical identity revolves around a build-and-spend resource (Thermal) that rewards continuous ability use by gating amplified states; maintaining those states amplifies his sustained cone damage, personal defenses and mobility, and converts autos into meaningful on-hit magic damage that scales with targets’ durability. He layers soft control and resistance reduction through repeatable projectiles while delivering a long-duration ground field that reshapes fight geometry. Strategically, he brings durable, predictable area denial and midline peel—excellent for forcing choke fights, securing objectives, and punishing flanks—trading raw mobility for consistent pressure and zone leverage.

name: Ryze
rationale: Ryze is a Battlemage: a spell-first caster whose design emphasizes sustained, high-impact spellcasting and single-target control rather than auto-attack trading or mobility. Mechanically he centers on building and spending a layered resource and mark system that lets him chain spells for amplified effects, rewarding precise combos, target sequencing, and positional setup while trading personal dash-style mobility for powerful ranged toolkit interactions and a channelled portal ability that repositions allies. Strategically he contributes reliable pick and peel through focused crowd control and chained damage, strong lane and wave pressure via spell spreading, and unique rotational/objective leverage by enabling coordinated team repositioning and tempo plays that hinge on timing and setup.

name: Samira
rationale: Skirmisher — Samira is designed as a close‑quarters duelist who converts momentum into combat power, fitting the skirmisher archetype because she thrives in fast, high‑risk one‑on‑one and small‑group fights rather than as a pure backline marksman. Mechanically she builds and spends momentum through consecutive hits and ability combos, alternates between ranged and melee options to prize proximity, and gains mobility to enter fights and reposition; she also provides a defensive counterplay by nullifying incoming projectiles while spinning. Strategically she offers a gap‑closing, sustained single‑target threat that snowballs with successful trades, a reliable dive and disruption tool in skirmishes and team fights, and a high‑variance carry option that demands space and timing to be effective.

name: Sejuani
rationale: Sejuani is a Vanguard — a front-line engager whose identity is centered on heavy, chained crowd control and durable disruption. Mechanically she revolves around applying and consuming Frost stacks to convert layered pressure into reliable immobilization, pairing a long-range, distance-empowered projectile with a forward charge that interrupts and displaces enemies and a sweeping area effect that pushes and slows. She also sustains a defensive armor layer after taking significant hits, so her impact is a blend of initiation and survivability. Strategically she functions as a primary engage and peel engine, providing multi-target lockdown, objective zone control through displacement and slows, and a forgiving frontline that enables allied follow-up and coordinated wombo plays.

name: Senna
rationale: Senna reads as an Artillery Mage–style marksman-support hybrid: a long-range poke and utility specialist who shapes engagements from safety. Her mechanical identity centers on empowered on‑attack beams that apply and then consume a lingering mist, converting sustained poking into scalable single-target payoff and rewarding repeated ranged pressure; that core on‑hit loop is paired with long-range supportive waves that heal allies and a global protective strike. She also generates persistent zone control via clinging mist and delayed crowd control and a short camouflage aura that enables concealed ally repositioning. Strategically she brings reliable long-range pressure and sustain, pick and zone control tools to set up fights, and global defensive peel and shielding rather than frontline engage.

name: Seraphine
rationale: Seraphine reads as an Enchanter with artillery tendencies: she is built around long-range, team-focused utility and layered area pressure rather than single-target dueling. Mechanically she rewards chaining and timing — casting patterns (including ally casts) build temporary resources that extend her basic attack reach, empower double-casts, and amplify subsequent spells, so her play revolves around orchestrating sustained poke, empowered autos, and sequenced spell bursts. Strategically she supplies reliable off‑angle poke, multi-target crowd-control windows, and proactive protection through shields and movement‑speed support, making her a teamfight conductor who enables siege and skirmish control, secures engages or disengages, and magnifies allied follow-up rather than hunting solo kills.

name: Sett
rationale: Sett is a Diver — a melee brawler who thrives by closing onto priority targets and forcing short, brutal exchanges. His mechanical identity centers on alternating basic attacks with an empowered strike, a grit resource that builds from damage taken and converts into a defensive buffer and bursty area follow-up, and reliable gap-closure plus forced repositioning to isolate or amplify targets. Strategically, Sett functions as a front-line duelist and single-target engager who both initiates fights and punishes isolated enemies, provides layered crowd-control and displacement to enable allied follow-up or peel, and turns extended trades into wins through sustain and execute-style burst.

name: Shaco
rationale: Shaco is an Assassin: his identity centers on stealth, surprise, and high single-target burst enabled by positioning rather than prolonged dueling. Mechanically he functions as a deception-based skirmisher that rewards flanking and timing—he uses brief invisibility and blink-like repositioning to set up enhanced rear attacks, deploys stealthed traps to deny vision and briefly disrupt enemy movement, applies on-hit slows and a ranged slowing/damage tool for engage and finish, and fields a disposable decoy that continues to threaten space and damage after his departure. Strategically he is a pick-creator and roamer who converts isolated kills into map pressure, enforces cautious movement through trap zoning, and provides lightweight split-push and disruptive teamfight presence by forcing enemies to react to deception and area denial.

name: Shen
rationale: Shen is a Warden: a tanky protector whose design emphasizes damage mitigation, target manipulation, and ally preservation. Mechanically he revolves around a persistent spirit weapon and an internal shield resource that he deploys through timing and positioning to empower extended-range melee pressure, create small interception zones that negate enemy basic attacks, and forcibly draw enemy focus via a targeted taunt while relocating himself. The kit rewards coordinated timing—refreshing defensive uptime by impacting multiple enemies, trading extended basic attacks against durable foes, and committing a global-channel rescue that both grants a temporary shield and instantly transports him to an ally. Strategically he supplies reliable peel and single-target saves, predictable initiation and disruption, sustained frontline durability, and decisive global presence that secures fights around objectives and enables safer plays for his team.

name: Shyvana
rationale: Shyvana functions as a Diver: a high-commitment melee initiator who transforms to close gaps, absorb disruption while displacing and carrying enemies, and force short-range engagements. Mechanically she is a sustained on-hit skirmisher whose kit rewards repeated basic attacks and aura uptime, trades mobility for potent close-range area damage and a form-based power spike, and is built around transforming into an empowered state that changes movement and combat behavior. Strategically she supplies dependable objective control and neutral-taker identity through dragon-focused scaling, rapid jungle clear and single-target neutral damage, reliable dive initiation and AOE presence in fights, and pressure by threatening isolation and extended brawls.

name: Singed
rationale: Singed is a Diver whose identity is built around forced proximity, sustained area denial, and single-target displacement. Mechanically he functions by generating persistent toxic space as he moves, using momentum-based mobility to repeatedly re-engage and extend encounters, and converting picks into extended crowd-control through a combo of fling and sticky zones. His toolkit refreshes effects through revisits and synergizes displacement with ground-control to lock targets into hazardous terrain while his self-buff window temporarily turns him into a durable, oppressive skirmisher that also applies anti-heal. Strategically he provides frontline disruption and zoning, reliable engage/peel through position manipulation, objective pressure via hazardous paths, and prolonged fight endurance that reshapes enemy movement.

name: Sion
rationale: Sion reads as a Diver: a committed frontline initiator who closes distance to displace and disrupt enemy formations with a high-commitment, momentum-driven toolkit. Mechanically he trades stop-and-go mobility for one-way commitment—charged, frontal disruption and an unstoppable, accelerating charge that enforces collision-based crowd control—while his longevity is driven by max‑health scaling and a shield that rewards bulk. His kit also includes persistent growth on takedowns and a unique post-death berserk window that converts elimination into a short-lived, fast melee threat that lifesteals and threatens big-health targets. Strategically he supplies reliable hard engage, area disruption and zone control, objective pressure through durable presence and execution threat, and a punish for overextended opponents that can finish fights even after he falls.

name: Sivir
rationale: Sivir is a Marksman because her design centers on sustained ranged auto-attack pressure and multi-target damage rather than single-target burst, serving as a primary sustained DPS and wave-control presence. Mechanically she is an attack-driven skirmisher that converts basic-attack uptime into battlefield control: short, repeatable empowered windows increase her attack cadence and projectile coverage, successful hits grant momentary mobility that reward aggressive repositioning and chase, and she has a single-use defensive tool that denies an enemy spell while restoring durability and triggering that mobility. Strategically she supplies reliable AOE waveclear and siege, consistent teamfight sustained damage, strong kiting and repositioning, a built-in counter to key enemy abilities, and a teamwide mobility engine that enables coordinated engages, disengages, and map tempo.

name: Skarner
rationale: As a Warden, Skarner acts as a durable frontline anchor that specializes in locking enemies down and controlling space through suppression and sustained pressure. His kit prizes prolonged contact: repeated melee strikes and empowered attack windows apply short‑lived stacking debuffs that culminate in health‑based burst damage, while an interruptible empowered strike can be converted into a ranged detonation for flexible engage or follow‑through. He pairs a large, health‑scaled shield and expanding area slow/damage for survivability and peel with a terrain‑bypassing dash that grants brief immunity to movement impairments for dependable gap‑closing and repositioning. His skewering suppression transforms picks into forced displacements, giving teams reliable initiation, objective control, and durable single‑to multi‑target lockdown that punishes prolonged trades and protects allies during commits.

name: Smolder
rationale: Smolder reads as a Skirmisher: a mobile duelist that scales through sustained engagement rather than burst windows, converting accumulated combat and last‑hit pressure into amplified spell effects. Mechanically he revolves around a stacking resource built from damaging champions and securing minions/monsters that augments his kit, merging targeted poke, area control, terrain‑traversing mobility that automatically pressures nearby foes, and a channeled frontal wave that provides self‑sustain and stronger punishment to enemies caught centrally. Strategically he supplies persistent 1v1/extended‑fight threat, zone and peel with slows and explosive follow‑ups, reliable sustain for prolonged skirmishes, and flexible split‑push and rotation potential via his terrain mobility.

name: Sona
rationale: Sona is an Enchanter support: a utility-focused, low-commitment backline champion whose toolkit centers on auras and ally-focused buffs rather than hard isolation or sustained frontline brawling. Mechanically she functions as a tag-and-proc spellcaster who accumulates and consumes passive charges through simple ability casts and basic attacks, trading direct mobility and durability for continuous ranged poke, periodic empowered autos, and conditional tempo gains when her movement-buff remains unbroken. Strategically she provides consistent lane pressure and sustain, layered movement utility to enable rotations or disengages, and a single, high-impact crowd-control ultimate that turns her diffuse support package into a decisive teamfight initiation or peel tool while primarily enabling and amplifying allied damage dealers.

name: Soraka
rationale: An Enchanter support built around reactive, high-impact healing and positional utility. Her identity is manipulating her own health as a resource to sustain allies, using restorative windows and returns from ranged harassment to reduce that cost and empower subsequent heals; she also gains directed mobility to reach critically wounded teammates. She shapes space with a persistent celestial zone that punishes enemy positioning and culminates in a disruptive crowd-control spike, while a global, low-health-prioritizing group heal provides battlefield-wide clutch saving potential. Overall she functions as a sustain-and-save specialist who controls fights through timely heals, zoning, and long-range rescue capability.

name: Swain
rationale: Swain is a battlemage who functions as a midline teamfight anchor rather than a pure burst caster; he embodies the Battlemage archetype by trading mobility for prolonged area presence, control, and sustained damage. Mechanically he revolves around harvesting persistent resources from enemy champions to convert into survivability and extended damage output—his toolkit combines revealing and rooting tools that set up recurring cone and AoE pulses, a transformation that prolongs combat through life-drain generation, and mechanics that reward re-engagements and isolated targets. Strategically he provides durable zone control and attrition: reliable midline pressure that punishes clustering, vision-enabled pick potential, objective control through sustained attrition, and a frontline threat that forces opponents to fight around his draining area rather than freely reposition.

name: Sylas
rationale: Sylas reads as a Skirmisher: a mobile melee duelist who thrives in short-range brawls and selective dives. Mechanically he revolves around generating and spending internal momentum to transition between bursty initiation and sustained close-quarters damage—combining a short-window repositioning tool into a follow-up displacement chain, stacking empowered basic attacks for rapid sustained output, and an on-hit life-recovery mechanic that rewards extended trades. His signature toolkit-level adaptability comes from temporarily appropriating enemy ultimate effects, letting him plug holes or amplify picks. Strategically he offers reliable single-target engage and execution, layered local disruption for skirmishes, sustained frontline pressure in teamfights, and flexible role coverage through his stolen ultimates.

name: Syndra
rationale: Artillery Mage — Syndra functions as a long-range burst mage who exerts control through conjured, interactable projectiles; she fits the artillery archetype because her core impact is delivered from range via precise, high-value spell combos rather than sustained dueling. Mechanically she is an object-based mage: her gameplay loop centers on creating and managing persistent spheres and a growth resource that amplifies her spells, then manipulating those objects to enhance displacement, add extra hits, and multiply damage; mastery comes from spatial placement, timed casts, and using held projectiles to alter ability outcomes. Strategically she brings potent single-target elimination and area denial—reliable lane shove and pick potential, zoning through knockback and short stuns, strong burst threat in skirmishes and teamfights, and requires teammates to capitalize on her ability to isolate or punish exposed champions.

name: Tahm Kench
rationale: Tahm Kench functions squarely as a Warden: a durable frontline whose core purpose is disruption and protection rather than pure damage. Mechanically he revolves around on-hit stacking pressure tied to his bulk, a stacking crowd-control tempo that culminates in lockdown, an instantaneous repositioning/engage that generates area disruption, a unique consume mechanic that can remove an ally or enemy from play and grant shielding or suppression, and a grey‑health system that converts received damage into delayed sustain—together these tools create a playstyle built on timed trades, target isolation, and baiting. Strategically he supplies reliable single‑target lockdown and peel, safe bodyblocking and ally safekeeping, and disruptive initiation that reshapes skirmishes and forces opponents to respond to his threat rather than bypass the frontline.

name: Taliyah
rationale: Taliyah functions as a Battlemage who reshapes the battlefield to trade positional advantage for ranged magic pressure. Mechanically she rewards terrain-aware play: movement and positioning near terrain grant mobility while her spells create persistent ground effects, volley-style projectile pressure, area slows, and a delayed displacement that forces enemy repositioning, with limitations that prevent repetitive casting in a single spot. Strategically she provides layered zoning and objective control, reliable waveclear and poke, and unique map-manipulation through a permanent wall that alters pathing—enabling roams, cross-map plays, picks via forced movement, and deliberate control of fight geometry.

name: Talon
rationale: Talon is an Assassin — a pure single-target skirmisher built to burst and roam from unexpected approaches; his identity centers on high mobility, short-window burst, and lethal priority rather than sustained fighting. Mechanically he stacks a bleed-like mark that primes a follow-up execute through autos, uses terrain vaulting to traverse and create unconventional attack angles with a per-passage limitation, and combines returning-dagger poke with a temporary stealth-and-rotational burst that amplifies trade windows and chase potential; eliminations grant sustain and restore his tempo by shortening his mobility cooldown. Strategically he provides reliable pick and roam pressure, punishes isolated targets, converts takedowns into snowball opportunities, and offers moderate wave control while avoiding prolonged front-line engagements.

name: Taric
rationale: Taric is a Warden because he centers on protecting allies and controlling space rather than solo damage. Mechanically he operates as a short-range support that empowers basic attacks to fuel healing and cooldown recovery, converts bonus defenses into both offensive and protective potency, and creates a persistent link with a teammate that shares and mirrors his defensive toolkit. He also offers a channeled area control effect that interrupts and a delayed areawide invulnerability that forces timing decisions. Strategically, he functions as a durable peel and teamfight anchor who enables aggressive engages or clutch survival windows through synchronized single-target mitigation, sustained heals, and timed global protection.

name: Teemo
rationale: Teemo functions as an Artillery: a ranged harassment and zone-control champion who shapes fights from a distance rather than winning through brute durability. Mechanically he centers on stealth-enabled positioning and hit-and-run pressure—remaining hidden to set up trades and gain transient offensive tempo when re-engaging—while sustained on-hit poison enforces prolonged punishment on targets that try to stay in range. He accumulates mobility when unbothered to kite or flank, and carries tools that temporarily neuter basic-attack-dependent foes. His stealthed area devices create persistent denial fields that slow and punish entry, converting vision control into objective and pick leverage. Strategically he provides reliable poke, map control, safe split-push pressure, and asymmetric pick potential, forcing opponents to contest space and invest resources in clearance and detection.

name: Thresh
rationale: Thresh is a Warden support built around long-range pick threat and layered crowd control. Mechanically he scales through a persistent collection resource that simultaneously augments his survivability and magical potency, and his kit revolves around tethered tools: a targeted displacement that initiates or confirms picks, a team-oriented rescue/redirect that can reposition allies, broad-area sweeps that forcibly move and slow foes, and temporary obstructive geometry that punishes entry. Strategically he functions as both a primary engage and peel engine—he creates pick windows, secures carries with proactive protection and relocation, controls space and chokepoints, and converts single-target hooks into decisive teamfight advantage through coordinated timing and positioning.

name: Tristana
rationale: Tristana is a Marksman defined by progressive reach and self-sufficient mobility: she embodies the ranged primary damage dealer archetype who scales into safer spacing through increasing attack range while maintaining high single-target pressure. Mechanically she revolves around auto-attack synergy and tempo windows—burst attack-speed phases combined with a resettable leap create a playstyle that chains kills or disengages on successful takedowns, while a stick-on timed explosion accelerates executes and enhances wave pressure; a powerful displacement offers both peel and offensive repositioning. Strategically she provides long-range sustained DPS, reliable pick and dive follow-through via resets, safe sieging and objective pressure from outranging threats, and built-in disruption/peel for her team.

name: Trundle
rationale: Trundle is a Skirmisher — a melee duelist built for prolonged, attritional fights that punish kiting and reward sustained proximity. Mechanically he enforces extended trades by combining an empowered attack and self-buffing presence with tools that alter battlefield geometry and directly leech resources from a single opponent, effectively converting enemy durability into his own; his kit favors sticking, raw sustain, and localized disruption over burst or ranged poke. Strategically, he offers dependable single-target removal and objective pressure: he isolates and weakens high-value targets, controls space to set up picks or protect flanks, anchors split-push threats, and turns drawn-out engagements into opportunities to outlast and out-gear opponents.

name: Tryndamere
rationale: Tryndamere is a Skirmisher: a melee duelist built to win extended one‑on‑one fights and force high‑risk all‑ins. Mechanically he centers on a charged resource that grows with aggression to amplify critical strike chance and can be consumed for meaningful sustain, combined with a missing‑health damage amplifier and a leap that both generates resource and secures positioning. His toolkit rewards trading at low health and using mobility to stick or disengage, while an ultimate creates a timed window of enforced survivability that enables reckless plays. Strategically he brings relentless split‑push and single‑target pressure, reliable tower‑diving and objective threat, and a carry‑focused disruption that demands committed crowd control or focused containment to neutralize.

name: Twisted Fate
rationale: Twisted Fate is an Artillery Mage — a long‑range spellcaster who combines multi‑target poke and empowered single attacks with unrivaled map mobility. His identity centers on cycling empowered basic attacks and stacking on‑hit effects into occasional burst, layered over a spread projectile that shapes waveclear and zone control, while a probabilistic gold‑on‑kill passive tweaks his resource tempo. His ultimate provides global reveal and a short‑range teleport, converting lane pressure into cross‑map playmaking. Strategically he offers sustained poke and wave control, a selectable single‑target utility option for picks or peel, and persistent global threat projection that forces enemy rotations and unlocks coordinated objective or pick play.

name: Twitch
rationale: Twitch reads as a Skirmisher-style marksman who plays like an assassin from range: he leverages concealment, poisoning, and extended reach to convert positioning into damage. Mechanically he relies on layering a persistent poison through repeated attacks and area control, amplifying effects when he times invisibility and movement to open fights; his kit detonates and scales with accumulated stacks and then switches his basic attacks into long-range, piercing projectiles for multi-target follow-through. Strategically he offers flank and ambush pressure, reliable backline shredding and prolonged single-target suppression, plus area denial that converts smart positioning into decisive teamfight and split-push value.

name: Udyr
rationale: Udyr functions as a Juggernaut — a melee brawler who dominates extended fights by trading durability for relentless close‑range pressure. Mechanically he centers on stance‑swapping: cycling between a set of empowered attack modes that modify his next hits and culminate in amplified final stances, creating a short‑cooldown, rhythm‑based playstyle rather than a traditional resource bar. The kit emphasizes on‑hit conversions, self‑sustain and shields, area harassment and movement windows with brief CC‑immunity, rewarding timing and weave management to stick and burst down targets. Strategically Udyr is a persistent frontline duelist and skirmisher who secures objectives, zones and disrupts backlines through sustained pressure and stickiness, forcing opponents to dedicate resources to contain him.

name: Urgot
rationale: Urgot is a Juggernaut — a durable, front-line fighter built to punish isolated enemies and secure kills through sustained, oppressive pressure. Mechanically he blends area-oriented ranged harassment with brutal close-quarters lockdown: his basic attacks trigger directional cone bursts that reward positioning and control space, he uses a placement-and-detonation tool to zone and set up engages, a high-force dash that displaces and stuns on collision to rearrange fights, and a mark-driven unstoppable pursuit state that prioritizes and relentlessly attacks marked targets, capped by a targeted suppression-execute. Strategically Urgot supplies single-target lockdown and guaranteed execution, reliable zone control to shape engagements, and a front-line anchor that creates pick potential and forces opponents into high-risk positioning choices.

name: Varus
rationale: Artillery Mage — Varus functions as a long-range poke and siege specialist who punishes poor spacing with charged skillshots and layered on-hit pressure. His mechanical identity centers on applying expendable stacks through basic attacks that are detonated by spells, creating windows of amplified burst that reward weaving autos and abilities rather than pure spell spam. He pairs a chargeable, extended-range projectile with an area-denial tool and a single-target immobilize that primes stacks, plus a kill-triggered offensive surge that temporarily boosts attack tempo and both attack- and spell-based output. Strategically he contributes persistent poke and siege, reliable zone control and anti-heal, and potent single-target pick or execute threat that synergizes with team setup and follow-up.

name: Vayne
rationale: Vayne reads as a Skirmisher: an isolated-duel focused marksman whose toolkit is built for high-mobility harassment, single-target execution, and outplay-based exchanges rather than raw teamfight control. Mechanically she centers on short, precise repositioning windows that empower her next attack and enable constant kiting and target resets, combined with a stacking true-damage mechanic that rewards sustained focus on one enemy and turns her into a specialist at shredding high-health foes. Her displacement that punishes terrain contact adds a skill-expressive form of hard crowd control and positional denial, while a timed powered-up mode amplifies damage and evasive tools to convert picks into kills. Strategically she supplies reliable single-target threat and split-pressure: an assassin-like duelist who forces opponents to respect isolation and terrain, creates high outplay potential through skillful spacing and timing, and naturally fills the role of frontline killer and flanker rather than area control or primary engage.

name: Veigar
rationale: Veigar is an Artillery Mage: a long-range, high-burst control caster who zones and punishes mispositioning. Mechanically he centers on stacking a permanent ability-power passive through ability hits and takedown interactions, turning routine spellcasting into progressive power growth; his toolkit emphasizes delayed area-impact and pinpoint single-target burst tied together by a cage-style crowd control that forces or punishes movement. Strategically he provides reliable pick threat and late-game one-shot potential, layered zone control for sieges and teamfights, and consistent wave pressure from repeatable nukes; he excels at setting up combos with allies, denying space, and converting small skirmishes or mistakes into decisive takedowns as the match progresses.

name: Vel'Koz
rationale: An Artillery Mage defined by extreme reach, predictive skillshot zoning and a sustained channel—he embodies long-range damage and analysis rather than frontline presence. Mechanically he layers a stacking true-damage proc through a persistent deconstruction counter, demands precise aiming with split-able projectiles and directional rifts, and offers a controllable, stoppable beam for extended punishment; he trades mobility for deliberate positioning and uses a short-duration displacement to set up combos and punish missteps. Strategically he provides siege and poke pressure, objective denial, reliable long-range waveclear, area denial and a precision execution tool that converts sustained harassment into guaranteed burst for teammates to capitalize on.

name: Vex
rationale: Artillery Mage — Vex is built as a long-range control mage that shapes fights from the backline rather than extended melee skirmishes. Mechanically she revolves around a mobility‑punishing mark and a shadow proxy that scales with cast distance: she rewards long‑range placement and mark consumption for burst and cooldown recovery while retaining a single‑target dash as a follow‑through option. Her kit blends ranged poke, distance‑scaling AoE, a defensive self‑shield, and a short fear to gate enemy approaches. Strategically she supplies reliable poke and wave control, zone denial and area slows for teamfights, vision/targeting on mobile threats, and a safe peel/short‑range engage tool to secure picks or punish dives.

name: Vi
rationale: Vi embodies the Diver archetype—a front-to-back engager who commits to single targets and forces cluttered fights into decisive skirmishes. Mechanically she centers on a chargeable gap‑closer that crescendos in range and impact, on‑hit stacking that converts to an execute-like interaction with built‑in armor reduction, and a fight‑sustaining shield mechanic that primes on her next offensive action and refreshes through extended trading; her empowered basic attack grants extended reach and cone damage for wave pressure and clustered threats, while a targeted displacement provides guaranteed lockdown on high‑value foes. Strategically she functions as a primary pick and initiation engine that shreds tanky frontlines, creates windows for follow‑up, pressures side lanes with opportunistic waveclear, and thrives in extended duels where shields and stack management determine outcomes.

name: Viego
rationale: Viego is a Skirmisher because he excels at isolated, extended duels and thrives by converting kills into continued fighting power and mobility rather than pure burst assassination. His kit orbits a possession mechanic that fundamentally transforms engagements: securing a takedown temporarily lets him appropriate an enemy’s kit and recover survivability, creating high-value resets and chaotic tradeoffs. Mechanically he blends on‑hit sustain and percent‑based finishing damage with targeted reposition tools, a chargeable single‑target lockdown, and a movement path that rewards restraint with speed and camouflage—plus an AoE displacement for disruption. Strategically he provides single‑target takeover, fight resets and cleanups, sustained skirmish pressure, flank and split‑push threat, and objective security by turning kills into renewed offensive windows for his team.

name: Viktor
rationale: Viktor is an Artillery Mage: a long-range, spell-focused caster who prioritizes durable poke and area denial over mobility. Mechanically he centers on a persistent augment progression—collecting upgrades that permanently enhance his spells and eventually empower his singularity tool—while combining empowered basic attacks and a short self-shield to shore up his fragility. His kit emphasizes sustained directional damage, persistent zone control, delayed hard crowd-control that punishes prolonged presence, and targeted interruption, so he excels at shaping space in fights, sieging and denying objectives, forcing enemy repositioning, and scaling into a teamfight-defining control and damage source as his augments arrive.

name: Vladimir
rationale: Battlemage — Vladimir functions as a sustained, scaling mage who converts between health and ability power to make defensive and offensive stats mutually reinforcing, fitting the Battlemage profile of extended skirmish dominance rather than short burst. Mechanically he revolves around an exchange economy: he spends and recovers health as a resource, builds and consumes short-term charge stacks to amplify spells, and relies on an untargetable mobility window for repositioning and safety. Strategically he brings reliable lane sustain and prolonged teamfight presence, area damage and crowd control that control space, a damage-amplifying debuff to increase team burst follow-up, and resilient front-to-back skirmishing that pressures objectives and punishes isolated targets.

name: Volibear
rationale: Diver — Volibear is a short‑range engager who commits to diving into enemy lines to disrupt and finish targets, fitting the Diver class through his leap‑centric initiation and turret‑threatening impact. Mechanically he is a momentum‑driven melee brawler that builds stacked attack momentum to convert sustained fighting into explosive on‑hit AoE, pairs a ghosted approach and an empowered leap for forced engages, and rewards single‑target stickiness with a wound/execute interaction that heals and scales with his durability; he also trades enemy maximum health for defensive shielding and applies area slows. Strategically he provides reliable hard initiation, close‑quarters disruption and sustained dueling presence, self‑sustain that lets him hold frontline space, target execution for pick threats, and objective pressure by threatening and temporarily neutralizing defensive structures.

name: Warwick
rationale: Warwick reads as a Diver: a single-target engager who closes on priority foes and anchors extended skirmishes. Mechanically he is built around health-threshold synergies and sustained on-hit conversion to self-heal, paired with a hunt mechanic that dramatically increases his chase and attack tempo against wounded targets. His toolkit blends a targeted gap-closer that suppresses and channels relentless damage with a defensive toggle that grants damage mitigation and a short-area crowd-control follow-up, enabling both stickiness and brief peel. Strategically he provides reliable pick and lockdown against carries, exceptional one-on-one dueling and sustain in prolonged fights, and objective pressure by forcing opponents to respect health and positioning thresholds.

name: Wukong
rationale: Wukong reads as a Diver: a mobile frontline skirmisher built to engage, stick to priority targets, and disrupt backlines. Mechanically he fuses gap-closing committal tools with deception and an empowered-basic attack, augmented by a defensive stacking passive that turns short trades into durable, repeatable duels; his kit spawns untargetable duplicates and grants brief concealment and repositioning to confuse targets, and his area-spin ultimate supplies sustained AoE damage with displacement to control space. Strategically he offers reliable flank and dive pressure, burst-to-sustain skirmishing, and teamfight disruption—rewarding timed engages, deceptive entries, and extended fights where durability stacks and area control determine the exchange.

name: Xayah
rationale: Marksman — Xayah is a ranged sustained DPS who defines herself through persistent projectile placement and retrieval rather than pure single-shot burst. Her mechanical identity centers on seeding spatially persistent feathers that augment basic attacks, creating layered on-hit damage and then calling those projectiles back to produce area damage and conditional crowd control; she also has a self-buff window that temporarily doubles attack output and grants mobility on champion hits, plus an untargetable repositioning burst that sprays directional projectiles. Strategically she offers reliable sustained damage combined with geometry-driven zone control and pick potential: she shapes fights by forcing opponents out of seeded areas, punishes poor spacing with mass-return roots, provides strong poke and waveclear, and pairs exceptionally well with an aggressive, mobile support for coordinated engages and skirmishes.

name: Xerath
rationale: Xerath is an Artillery Mage: a stationary extreme-range caster whose identity centers on long-distance harassment and zone control. Mechanically he relies on chargeable, travel-dependent skillshots and a channeled multi-missile ultimate that grows stronger as he lands hits on enemy champions, while sustaining his arcane energy through on-hit restorations and takedown-linked renewal. Strategically he enforces space and objective pressure from safety, offering reliable poke, delayed AoE disruption with heightened center impact, and travel-distance-scaled crowd control for picks; his strengths demand disciplined positioning and timing, trading mobility for unparalleled ranged threat and siege presence.

name: Xin Zhao
rationale: Xin Zhao fits the Skirmisher archetype: a melee duelist built to pick a single opponent, close the gap, and win brief, committed fights. His mechanical identity orbits empowered basic-attack sequences that convert sustained trading into burst and self-sustain, combined with an empowered-hit chain that enforces commitment and refreshes his combat uptime. He couples a targeted gap-close and small-area disruption with an attack-speed/onslaught steroid to reliably stick to and pressure targets. Strategically he delivers dependable single-target lockdown and sustained 1v1 threat, punishes isolated enemies, creates close-range denial against ranged foes, and anchors melees as an initiator and skirmish finisher.

name: Yasuo
rationale: Skirmisher — a mobile, close-range duelist that excels in layered trades and extended fights through repeated repositioning and high-risk outplay potential. Mechanically he revolves around stacking internal resources that both grant a defensive shield and improve his crit efficiency while building offensive charges from successive thrusts and dashes; those charges convert into a reliable airborne disruption that he can capitalize on to reposition and chain follow-up damage. His toolkit emphasizes on‑hit interactions, short-range mobility through enemy targets, and a directional projectile barrier that creates reactive defensive windows. Strategically he supplies dependable single-target pick and skirmish initiation, vertical CC that enables team follow-ups, strong 1v1 and split-pressure, and a projectile-denial plane that can blunt poke and enable decisive re-engagements once his stacks are established.

name: Yone
rationale: Yone reads as a Skirmisher—an agile duelist built to win extended fights and create flank or pick windows—because his kit centers on single-target threat, layered mobility, and self-sustain rather than pure burst or frontline tanking. Mechanically he is a dual‑blade hybrid attacker: basic attacks alternate between two swords dealing both physical and magic damage while trading higher critical chance for reduced crit multiplier; he stacks on-hit hits into a powered dash, has a cone that deals damage proportional to target maximum health and grants a short shield, can separate into a spirit form that reactivates to reunite and deal true damage to marked foes, and wields an area charge that stuns, teleports him behind distant targets and pulls them. Strategically he supplies sustained single-target dueling, flank and gap‑closing pressure that can bypass frontlines, built‑in survivability for extended trades, and reliable lockdown/repositioning for picks and teamfight initiation.

name: Yorick
rationale: Fighter (split-pusher / juggernaut) — Yorick functions as a durable, lane‑centric melee champion who prizes sustained trades and local superiority. Mechanically he builds persistent battlefield presence by converting dead foes into controllable summons and by summoning a single, autonomous powerhouse that generates additional minions; he pairs that with an empowered basic attack that provides ranged reach and self‑sustain, a targeted displacement that creates temporary terrain for zoning and isolation, and a marking/impeding effect that amplifies follow‑up on marked targets. Strategically he pressures side‑lanes and objectives through summoned forces, creates oppressive local numbers to win extended skirmishes, shapes fights by denying movement and isolating carries, and forces opponents to respond to his anchored, objective‑oriented split‑push threat.

name: Yuumi
rationale: An Enchanter support that functions as a tethered utility conduit rather than an independent frontline presence. Mechanically she revolves around attaching to allies to become untargetable and to project her kit from their position, accumulating affinity with teammates that changes where her benefits are strongest. Her toolkit emphasizes remote sustain, shields, movement and attack-speed assistance, and guided poke and zoning that scale in potency while bonded; excess healing converts to protection, and resource restoration further empowers allies. Strategically she supplies consistent single-target sustain and peel, layered protection for a carry, empowered poke and zone control from safety, and high flexibility in where team benefits are concentrated at any moment.

name: Zac
rationale: Zac is a Diver: his design centers on high-commitment, long-range initiation and sustained in-combat mobility that allows him to plunge into enemy formations and disrupt backlines. Mechanically he converts his own durability into a playmaking resource—damaging actions spawn contested pickups that restore health and refresh uptime—paired with a charge-and-launch entry that can be recast, a tethered follow-up that extends trades, and a multi-impact aerial sequence that displaces and slows foes; a built-in failstate revival grants him unusual tolerance for all-in plays. Strategically he supplies reliable frontline engage, layered crowd control and zone disruption, sustained dive threat and objective pressure, and the ability to force mispositioning and bait enemy cooldowns.

name: Zed
rationale: Assassin — Zed is a mobile, high-burst skirmisher who embodies clean single-target execution and shadow-based deception; he fits the Assassin class because his kit is built to isolate and rapidly eliminate priority targets through timed windows of vulnerability. Mechanically he operates by creating controllable shadow duplicates that mirror selected attacks, enabling asynchronous multi-source pressure, extended reach, and shadow-swapping for repositioning; he pairs that with a built-in amplified-damage mechanic that punishes already-weakened foes (with an internal gating to prevent repetition) and a mark that converts damage dealt during its duration into concentrated burst. Strategically he offers lethal pick potential, fan-out pressure via duplicated zoning and poke, strong short-trade and outplay opportunities through shadow mobility and a brief untargetable engage, and a constant threat that forces opponents to respect his assassination timing and positioning in skirmishes and split engagements.

name: Zeri
rationale: Zeri is a Marksman with strong skirmisher tendencies: she functions as a mobile, duelist-focused ranged carry who leverages movement and terrain to reforge engagements. Mechanically she alternates between two attack identities—movement‑charged basic shots that act as spell damage and a separate burst volley that behaves like a conventional crit/on‑hit‑capable attack—while her toolkit rewards weaving movement, ability casts and charged attacks to refresh mobility windows and sustain an empowered state. Strategically Zeri supplies mobile sustained DPS, excellent kiting and extended trades, plus terrain-driven assassination and zone control; she excels at hit‑and‑run skirmishes, dynamic repositioning for single‑target pressure, and maintaining prolonged output in extended fights.

name: Ziggs
rationale: Ziggs is an Artillery Mage: a long-range, indirect damage specialist built around explosive zone control and siege. Mechanically he functions by layering area-of-effect explosives and persistent pressure—his kit rewards weaving ability use and empowered basic attacks to maintain steady poke and enhanced structure damage while sacrificing frontline stickiness for stand-off safety. He creates constrained fight geometry with mines and area bursts that punish approach, offers a targeted displacement tool for repositioning or peeling, and carries a large, high-impact finisher that compels opponents to avoid a precise ground point. Strategically, Ziggs supplies reliable poke and waveclear, objective and turret siege pressure, area denial for flank control, and a safe, tempo-oriented way to force fights and secure objectives.

name: Zilean
rationale: Zilean is an Enchanter utility mage defined by temporal manipulation rather than raw burst or frontline durability. Mechanically he centers on resource and cooldown control: he stockpiles and reallocates progression to accelerate allies, resets his own spell rhythm, and uses attachable area explosives plus movement-altering effects to punish mispositioning and shape space. This kit sacrifices personal tankiness and sustained damage for high-value timing plays and tempo denial—providing zoning, reveal, and peel through bombs and slows while enabling clutch outs via a single-target temporal resurrection. Strategically he supplies tempo control and power-spike acceleration, turning moments of overextension into picks, enabling aggressive tempo plays, and reliably protecting key carries.

name: Zoe
rationale: Zoe is an Artillery Mage: a long-range, skillshot-focused burst caster whose identity is centered on delivering high single-target and poke damage from distance rather than extended trades. Mechanically she functions as a combo-dependent skirmisher that builds advantage through precise setup and timing—her kit rewards chaining an empowered follow-up attack, travel-distance scaling projectiles, and brief stolen/external-ability utility with a short reposition that automatically returns her to safety. Success depends on landing disruptive crowd-control or difficult skillshots to create high-damage opportunities and on exploiting temporary extra bolts/utility. Strategically she supplies pick potential, long-range siege and zone control, roaming pressure through sudden utility spikes, and high outplay expression at the cost of low frontline durability and limited sustained teamfight presence.

name: Zyra
rationale: Zyra reads as an Artillery Mage who shapes fights from a distance by seeding the battlefield and forcing opponents to navigate around persistent hazards; her identity is rooted in long-range zone control rather than sustained melee trading. Mechanically she operates around deployable seed objects and a stored-plant currency that she places and then activates with her spells to spawn short-lived autonomous plants that extend her cast volume, layering poke, incidental vision, and intermittent damage; seeds are interactive (can be destroyed by enemy movement and briefly reveal their destroyer), and many of her spells gain additional utility when they intersect with seeds. Strategically she provides sustained area denial, layered poke and objective control, flank-threat pressure through summonable minions, and multi-target crowd control that converts single-target engages into teamfight advantages, favoring map shaping and zoning over straightforward dueling.
